0.title: RBI telling fintechs 'Don't do digital lending': Grover on RBI's new rules
0.article_body: BharatPe Co-founder Ashneer Grover has criticised the RBI's new digital lending guidelines, calling it the worst "regulatory innovation in the world". Grover wrote in a tweet, "RBI is telling fintechs 'Bhai mat karo digital lending shending'." The new rules bar lenders from storing borrowers' data and require direct transfer of disbursements and repayments between borrowers and regulated entities.

1.title: Three more matches, then we never have to play tennis: Kyrgios
1.article_body: After reaching the US Open quarterfinals for the first time, Australian tennis player Nick Kyrgios said, "I'm just glad I'm finally able to show New York my talent...I haven't had too many great trips here." He jokingly added, "Three more matches potentially...then we never have to play tennis again." Kyrgios defeated world number one Daniil Medvedev in his round-of-16 match.

2.title: You can love me, hate me; but don’t be indifferent to me: Karan Johar
2.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar has said that he does not fear failure, however, he fears indifference now. "Over the years, [the fear of being trolled] started diminishing. I am afraid that I may do something and no one would care about it," he further added. Karan's next directorial 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani' features Ranveer Singh and Alia Bhatt.

3.title: Protests held at 3 railway stations in WB seeking increased train frequency
3.article_body: Protests were staged at three railway stations in West Bengal's Hooghly district on Monday demanding increase in train service frequency to accommodate passenger rush. The protests were held at Khanyan, Palandu and Pandua stations with stones reportedly being hurled at a train in Khanyan. Railway officials stated services have been curtailed over ongoing work on a stretch of railway tracks.

4.title: We try to reach out to all but some leave after abusing us: Congress leader
4.article_body: Congress is a democratic party and it stands united, Congress' Jairam Ramesh said. "We try to take all people together. We try to reach out to all people but still, some leave after abusing us. I don't want to comment on them," Ramesh added. Furthermore, he said, "We don't silence voices. Those who are not satisfied issue statements. Some...write letters...tweet."

5.title: I feel like it’s a privilege: Mouni Roy on being part of 'Brahmastra'
5.article_body: Actress Mouni Roy has said that she feels it is a privilege to be a part of Ranbir Kapoor-starrer 'Brahmastra'. "It made so much of a difference in terms of the experience that I gained while shooting this film, the kinds of things that I have learned while shooting this film," she added. The film will also feature Alia Bhatt.

6.title: Ukraine's Shmyhal meets Germany's Scholz to discuss military aid
6.article_body: Ukrainian Prime Minister Denys Shmyhal met German Chancellor Olaf Scholz in Berlin on Sunday. Shmyhal acknowledged that Berlin stepped up military aid by providing heavy armaments like the howitzer 2000 and rocket launchers. Ukrainian PM, who was welcomed with military honours, is the first high-level Ukrainian official to visit Germany in several months.

7.title: Scam worth over ₹100 crore found in Madhya Pradesh govt's free food scheme: Report
7.article_body: According to a report by Madhya Pradesh's Accountant General, irregularities worth over ₹100 crore in the identification of beneficiaries and in the production and distribution of Take Home Ration (THR) have surfaced in the state's nutrition programme. Notably, even the trucks that were claimed to have been used for ration transportation were found to be motorcycles, cars, autos and tankers.

8.title: BBMP identifies 696 encroachments in Bengaluru, issues notices
8.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has identified 696 encroachments in the city and issued notices to 32 people. The action comes after CM Basavaraj Bommai directed authorities to remove properties encroaching on the drains after he visited flooded areas. The highest number of 175 encroachments were reported in Mahadevapura area followed by 126 encroachments in Dasarahalli.

9.title: Tharoor met Gehlot to discuss about AICC Presidential polls: Reports
9.article_body: According to reports, senior Congress leader Shashi Tharoor met Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot in Delhi and discussed about the party's future as well as the upcoming AICC Presidential polls. Earlier last week, Gehlot had said that efforts will be made till the last minute to persuade Rahul Gandhi to take over the reins of the party again.

10.title: Some plunge into poll battle just 5 months earlier with huge promises: Shah
10.article_body: Union Minister Amit Shah on Sunday said that some people plunge into the poll battle just about five months earlier with huge promises against others who work hard for five years, before asking for votes. Shah made the remark in Ahmedabad without naming anyone. He inaugurated four smart schools in Ahmedabad city on Sunday.

11.title: Mumbai school principal to be conferred with National Award by President
11.article_body: Principal of a Mumbai school, Kavita Sanghvi, is set to be conferred with the National Award by President Droupadi Murmu on the occasion of Teacher’s Day. She joined 45 other educators from across the country in the honours list. “It’s going to be a very special event for me as it is recognition of my hard work,” said Sanghvi.

12.title: Las Vegas investigative journalist stabbed to death outside home
12.article_body: A 69-year-old investigative journalist, Jeff German, was stabbed to death outside his house in US' Las Vegas, authorities said. A police spokesperson said that police believe that an altercation had taken place, adding, "We do have some leads. We're pursuing a suspect but the suspect is outstanding." The city's Mayor Carolyn G Goodman called it a "senseless act of violence".

13.title: Speculative: Federal Bank on report claiming its merger with Kotak Bank
13.article_body: Reacting to a media report claiming its merger with Kotak Mahindra Bank, Federal Bank clarified that the report is "speculative in nature". In an exchange filing, it said that there was "no such information available with the company". Earlier, a report while quoting sources said that the top management of both banks had met for a potential deal.

14.title: I was scared about not wearing any makeup in 'Maharani': Huma Qureshi
14.article_body: Actress Huma Qureshi said she was scared about not wearing makeup in the series 'Maharani'. "In season 2, at least I'm the chief minister so I'm in better clothes. In season 1, I...had rubber slippers, dirty synthetic saree that I would pull up...tuck in (above the stomach)," she stated. Huma revealed she was "petrified" when she heard the show's script.

15.title: Kitten rescued from burning building in Ukraine; video surfaces
15.article_body: A video of firefighters rescuing a kitten from a burning building in Ukraine has surfaced online. According to the country's emergency services, the rescuers pulled out the kitten from the rubble of the hotel-restaurant complex that was hit by a rocket, which in turn had caused the fire, in Kharkiv. The video shows the firefighters petting and cuddling the kitten.

16.title: If we had more wickets in hand, I would've tried to hit more sixes: Kohli
16.article_body: Talking about his 60(44) against Pakistan, Virat Kohli said he made a "conscious effort to strike at a higher pace" but he ended up in a situation where he had to "go deep". He added, "When we lost wickets, there was communication and our plans changed...if there were a couple of batters, I would've gone with the same tempo."

17.title: Robbers pose as income tax officials, loot ₹25 lakh from Ludhiana farmer
17.article_body: Four men posed as income tax officials to raid the house of a Ludhiana farmer and seized ₹25 lakh before leaving. The victim stated in his complaint he had sold 21-acre land and kept part of the money at home to buy more land. He said some of the robbers were carrying pistols and locked the family in a room.

18.title: Church must show zero tolerance: Pope on sexual abuse by clergy
18.article_body: Pope Francis said during an interview on Sunday that the Catholic Church must show "zero tolerance" over sexual abuse by the clergy. "A priest cannot continue being a priest if he is an aggressor. He cannot because he is either sick or a criminal," he added. He further said that such an act is "monstrous" as it destroys lives.

19.title: Will speak to B'luru IT companies regarding ₹225 cr loss due to rain: CM Bommai
19.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Monday said that he will call Bengaluru-based IT and banking companies which said that they collectively lost ₹225 crore due to the flooding of Outer Ring Road. "I will speak with them related to issues they're facing (due to waterlogging). We'll also discuss the compensation and other related damages caused due to rain," he added.

20.title: BYJU'S to raise over $500 million at $23 billion valuation: Report
20.article_body: Edtech platform BYJU'S is likely to raise more than $500 million at a valuation of $23 billion in a week, PTI reported. BYJU'S is reportedly in talks with Abu Dhabi's sovereign wealth funds to raise $400-500 million and with Qatar Investment Authority (QIA) to raise $250-350 million. The company is mulling over using funds for acquisition in the US.

21.title: Last rites of Karnataka police dog conducted with full state honours
21.article_body: The Karnataka Police on Sunday conducted the last rites of a service dog who served the department for over 11 years with full state honours. Geetha, an 11-year-old labrador retriever dog, passed away on Saturday following prolonged illness. Geetha was deployed extensively in the security and explosive detection work during the arrival of VVIPs and other huge public gatherings..

22.title: Paytm shares fall over 6% in early trade after ED raid in Chinese loan apps probe
22.article_body: Shares of Paytm’s parent company One 97 Communications declined over 6% in Monday's early trade. The Enforcement Directorate had conducted a raid at the company's Bengaluru premises over the weekend in connection with a Chinese loan apps case. At the day's low of ₹681.20, the share price was trading at a discount of 68% from its issue price of ₹2,150.

23.title: Bed Bath & Beyond CFO was sued over $1.2bn loss to shareholders days before death
23.article_body: Bed Bath & Beyond CFO Gustavo Arnal, who died after jumping from NYC's 'Jenga Building' on Friday, was sued by a group of shareholders on August 23, court documents show. The lawsuit accused Arnal and major shareholder Ryan Cohen of artificially inflating the firm's stock price through a 'pump and dump' scheme. The shareholders claimed they lost around $1.2 billion.

24.title: Why is he sitting on CM post?: Annie Raja on Soren's 'incidents happen' remark
24.article_body: General Secretary of National Federation of Indian Women (NFIW) Annie Raja criticised Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren for his "incidents happen" remark while responding to a question on a tribal girl’s rape and murder in Dumka. "Why is he sitting on the CM post? He is there to ensure that this kind of incident is prevented," Raja said.

25.title: Lucknow man arrested for 'love jihad', raping, assaulting wife
25.article_body: A 39-year-old gym owner in Lucknow has been arrested for marrying a woman by allegedly concealing his identity and posing as a Hindu man. The accused married her in a temple and later forced her to change her religion, threatening her with dire consequences, police said. The victim has further accused him of rape and having unnatural sex with her.

26.title: Euro declines below $0.99 for the first time in 20 years
26.article_body: The euro fell below $0.99 for the first time in 20 years on Monday, after Russia shut down a major gas pipeline to Europe. The currency fell as much as 0.7% to a low of $0.9888 in afternoon trading in Asia. Earlier, the US dollar index hit 110.086 in Asia's morning trade, reaching a new two-decade high.

27.title: Azad twisting facts, distorting history to gain sympathy from people of J&K: Cong
27.article_body: Congress General Secretary of Communications Jairam Ramesh said that former Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad is twisting facts and distorting history in order to generate undue sympathy from the people of Jammu and Kashmir. He further said Azad's claims of being a politician connected with people is a lie, adding he never won any election other than an assembly by-election.

28.title: MBT member posts fake news about Raja Singh, detained in Hyderabad
28.article_body: A member of the political party Majlis Bachao Tehreek (MBT) was detained in Hyderabad for allegedly posting fake news about suspended BJP leader T Raja Singh. The accused had claimed in the post that Singh, who has been jailed under the Preventive Detention Act, will be released on Monday. Singh was jailed after being accused of insulting Prophet Muhammad.

29.title: 2 killed, at least 5 trapped in fire at Hotel Levana in Lucknow
29.article_body: Two people were killed after a fire broke out in Hotel Levana in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow. Reports said that 20 people have been rescued. However, five to six people are still feared trapped inside the hotel building. The fire broke out on Monday morning. Eyewitnesses said that several guests tried escaping the hotel by breaking the windows of their rooms.

30.title: Working on 'Aashiqui 3' is like dream come true: Actor Kartik Aaryan
30.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan, who will be featuring in 'Aashiqui 3', has said that working on the film is a "dream come true" for him. "The timeless classic 'Aashiqui' is something I grew up watching...I feel privileged yet grateful for collaborating with Bhushan Kumar and Mukesh Bhatt for this opportunity," he added. The film will be directed by Anurag Basu.

31.title: Gurugram's Appu Ghar sealed over non payment of dues of over ₹48.56 cr
31.article_body: The Haryana Shehri Vikas Pradhikaran (HSVP) has sealed Appu Ghar amusement park in Gurugram over alleged non-payment of dues of over ₹48.56 crore including penalties. An official said several notices had been served to the amusement park authorities and that they have defaulted on the payment. The park operator's lease agreement was also terminated earlier.

32.title: Mumbai businessman booked for allegedly forging ID card of DRDO
32.article_body: Mumbai police has booked a 72-year-old businessman for possessing a fake identity card of the Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO). The man allegedly created the bogus ID to get his work done quickly at the passport office. He was booked for pretending to be an official and carrying a token used by officials with fraudulent intent.

33.title: Mumbai Traffic Police asked not to use personal phones for snapping violators
33.article_body: The Additional Director General of Police (Traffic) issued notification warning Mumbai Traffic Police against use of personal mobile phones to issue e-challans to violators. The ADG asked traffic police to use cameras on the e-challan machines to click photos. There were several complaints that vehicle photos clicked on personal mobile phones were not appropriate and uploaded late, the ADG said.

34.title: K'taka government to investigate scams under Congress rule: Ravi
34.article_body: BJP National General Secretary CT Ravi claimed that the Karnataka government will investigate all the scams that took place under the previous Congress regime. "Many scams during the Congress government have been covered up. There was a long discussion in the meeting about uncovering and investigating such scams and taking strict action against the culprits," said Ravi.

35.title: SpaceX launches 51 Starlink satellites in its 40th mission of 2022
35.article_body: SpaceX has successfully launched a batch of 51 Starlink satellites completing its 40th mission of 2022. Seattle-based company Spaceflight's space tug Sherpa-LTC2 was also onboard with the Starlink satellites. Last week, SpaceX CEO Elon Musk said the firm is launching Starlink satellites roughly every five days now and plans to launch 100 orbital missions in 2023.

36.title: 8 die climbing volcano in Russia, strong winds delay rescue
36.article_body: Eight people lost their lives while climbing the Klyuchevskaya Sopka volcano in Russia's far east, according to Interfax news agency. A group of 12 people, including two guides, had set out to climb a 4,754 metre volcano on Tuesday but some climbers fell from 4,200 metres, authorities said. Rescuers returned amid strong winds which prevented their helicopter from landing.

37.title: Have finally seen every shot in Brahmāstra, emotional moment for me: Ayan
37.article_body: Taking to Instagram, 'Brahmāstra' director Ayan Mukerji shared a behind-the-scenes clip from the sets of the film. Along with the video, Ayan wrote, "Yesterday was the first time, I saw every shot in 'Brahmāstra' - finally finished, polished and ready for its audience." He added that it was an emotional moment for him as the journey was "long and challenging".

38.title: Strong speech: Tharoor after Rahul addressed Congress' rally in Delhi
38.article_body: After Congress leader Rahul Gandhi addressed the ‘Mehangai par halla bol’ rally in Delhi on Sunday, Congress' Shashi Tharoor tweeted "strong speech". Tharoor added, "A strong speech...roused huge crowds thronging Ramlila Maidan. Now to take message across the country in Bharat Jodo Yatra." Gandhi in his speech said, "I want to tell PM Modi, I'm not scared of your ED."

39.title: India reports 5,910 new COVID-19 cases and 16 deaths, positivity rate at 2.60%
39.article_body: India has reported 5,910 new COVID-19 cases and nine deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Health Ministry. Additionally, seven reconciled deaths from earlier period were added in Kerala. This comes a day after the country recorded 6,809 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in the country dropped to 53,974, while the daily positivity rate stood at 2.60%.

40.title: Just stared at ceiling till 5 am, thought my career is over: Kohli on CT 2009 match vs Pak
40.article_body: On being asked about Arshdeep Singh being criticised for dropping a catch against Pakistan in Asia Cup match, Virat Kohli said, "Everyone makes mistakes under pressure." He stated, "I remember...I got out playing...bad shot against Shahid Afridi in my first Champions Trophy match in 2009." He added, "[After the match]...I just stared at...ceiling till 5 am...thought my career is over."

41.title: Rohit Sharma gets angry at Rishabh Pant in dressing room after his wicket, video viral
41.article_body: A video of Team India captain Rohit Sharma getting angry at Rishabh Pant after the latter's dismissal against Pakistan in their Asia Cup 2022 Super 4 stage match has gone viral. In the video, Rohit can be seen seemingly scolding Pant about his shot selection. Pant was dismissed for 14(12) after playing a reverse sweep against Shadab Khan.

42.title: Shame on people saying cheap things about him: Harbhajan on Arshdeep getting abused
42.article_body: Ex-India off-spinner Harbhajan Singh took to Twitter to defend pacer Arshdeep Singh after he was abused on social media for dropping a catch against Pakistan during India's five-wicket defeat on Sunday. "Stop criticising young Arshdeep...No one [drops] the catch purposely...Shame on...people who [are] putting our own guys down by saying cheap things...about Arsh and team...Arsh is GOLD," he added.

43.title: I'll always wear seat belt, even when in rear seat: Mahindra after Mistry's death
43.article_body: Businessman Anand Mahindra tweeted, "I resolve to always wear my seat belt even when in the rear seat of the car," after former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry was killed in a road accident near Mumbai on Sunday. Mistry was in the backseat and wasn't wearing his seat belt when the overspeeding car hit a divider, preliminary police probe found.

44.title: Traffic restrictions in Mumbai's western suburbs due to VVIP visit
44.article_body: Mumbai police has rolled out traffic restrictions due to a scheduled VVIP visit. The movement will be slow at Malabar Hill, Babulnath, Kemp's Corner, Haji Ali, Mahalaxmi Race Course, Saat Rasta, Chinchpokli Junction, Lalbaug Parel, Lotus Junction, Worli Dairy, Worli Sea Link and Lilavati Junction areas between 9 am to 12:30 pm.

45.title: Woman constable booked in Punjab's Mohali for cheating, impersonation
45.article_body: A woman constable posted with Cyber Crime Cell has been booked in Punjab's Mohali for allegedly impersonating another police personnel and lodging fake complaints with senior officers. The accused lodged complaints in order to defame the personnel, police said. The incident came to light when an inquiry was conducted by an ADGP level officer following which the case was registered.

46.title: Man climbs one of the tallest buildings in UK, shares selfie from the top; arrested
46.article_body: A 21-year-old man was arrested on suspicion of trespass in London after he was seen climbing one of the tallest buildings in the UK on Sunday. The man, believed to be free climber Adam Lockwood, scaled the 1,017 ft-tall skyscraper, called 'The Shard', barefoot. He later posted a selfie on Facebook from the top of the building, captioned, "Shard, 04/09/2022."

47.title: Tamil Nadu minister V Senthil Balaji's Twitter account hacked briefly
47.article_body: Tamil Nadu Minister of Electricity, Prohibition and Excise V Senthil Balaji's Twitter account was briefly hacked on Sunday but got restored later in the day. The account showed a different display name and requested people to make use of cryptocurrencies. He later thanked state cyber crime wing and Twitter officials for restoring his account which has over two lakh followers.

48.title: Most sedition cases in last 8 years came from Assam: NCRB data
48.article_body: A National Crime Records Bureau (NCRB) report stated that 76 sedition cases were registered across the country in 2021 which is a marginal increase from the 73 registered in 2020. Most of the sedition cases in the last eight years have come from Assam, the report stated. The number of cases stood at 93 in 2019 and 70 in 2018.

49.title: Restoration of full statehood of J&K, right to land priority: Azad
49.article_body: Veteran politician Ghulam Nabi Azad, who recently quit Congress citing Rahul Gandhi's "immaturity", has stated that the restoration of full statehood of Jammu and Kashmir will be the priority of his new party. He said that no one from outside Jammu and Kashmir shall be allowed to purchase land there and no jobs shall go to outsiders.

50.title: Boat carrying 55 people capsizes in Ganga river in Bihar's Danapur, 10 people missing
50.article_body: A boat carrying 55 people capsized in Bihar's Danapur on Sunday. Reports said that 10 people are missing and the search operation is underway. The incident took place while the labourers were returning from work. News agency ANI reported that people gathered around the river soon after the news of the sinking of the boat spread.

51.title: World no. 1 Medvedev crashes out of US Open, loses to Kyrgios
51.article_body: Defending champion and world number one Daniil Medvedev has crashed out of the US Open after losing to Australian Nick Kyrgios in their round-of-16 match. Notably, this is the first time Kyrgios has reached the quarterfinals at Flushing Meadows. "I want to go all the way," said Kyrgios after winning the match with a scoreline of 7-6(13-11), 3-6, 6-3, 6-2.

52.title: Thunderstorms cause flash floods in US' Georgia; emergency declared
52.article_body: Thunderstorms and heavy rainfall caused flash flooding in US' Georgia, following which the state Governor Brian P Kemp declared a state of emergency in Chattooga and Floyd Counties. According to Kemp's order, the area received an estimated 12 inches of rainfall which caused rivers to "rise rapidly". The National Weather Service said that the situation is "extremely dangerous and life-threatening".

53.title: Hardcore, loyal Shiv Sainiks will fight back: Ex-Maha CM Thackeray
53.article_body: Former Maharashtra CM and Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray on Sunday said "loyal and hardcore" Shiv Sainiks will fight back against the current political situation. Thackeray was addressing the members of the Vahatuk Sena, the transport wing of the party, at his residence. Thackeray said he has received 11,000 new membership forms and affidavits from the Vahatuk Sena.

54.title: Anand & 1.5L other Indians managed genetic hair fall: Traya
54.article_body: Anand from Nashik covered his bald patch in 5 months, shared Traya, revealing that it has found a breakthrough in managing genetic hairfall. Internal factors like stress, nutrition and digestion accelerate balding, therefore it combines 3 sciences- ayurveda, dermatology and nutrition to target these root causes, Traya stated. It offers an online hair test to build a customized treatment plan.

55.title: Bengaluru Police shares list of roads to avoid due to waterlogging
55.article_body: As heavy rain lashed out Bengaluru, the HSR Layout Traffic Police shared list of roads to avoid due to waterlogging and suggested people to use alternative roads. The police asked commuters to avoid - Outer Ring Road, Sarjapura road, Doddakannelli road, Bellandur road. The Outer Ring Road (ORR) was flooded for the second time in a week.

56.title: Cyrus Mistry was brought dead with a head injury after accident: Doctor
56.article_body: Former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry was brought dead to the hospital and had received a head injury during the accident, said a doctor who attended to him at a government hospital in Kasa. He added that his co-passenger Jehangir Pandole died during the transit. According to the police, the accident happened as the driver lost control because of overspeeding.

57.title: Carnival swing with 50 people on board crashes down from 50 feet in Punjab; video surfaces
57.article_body: A swing with nearly 50 people on board broke mid-air and crashed down from a height of 50 feet during a fair in Punjab's Mohali on Sunday, ANI reported. According to The Indian Express, at least 15 people, mostly children and women, were injured in the incident. The injured persons were shifted to a hospital after the incident, reports said.

58.title: People trying to give Patkar backdoor entry into Guj politics: Shah
58.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah has criticised AAP, claiming that some people were trying to give activist Medha Patkar a "backdoor entry" into Gujarat politics. "Those who want to bring...Patkar, who opposed Gujarat and our lifeline Narmada project...should stop here itself. There's no place for those opposing Gujarat," he added. Patkar was fielded by AAP in 2014 Lok Sabha elections.

59.title: Out of all I've played with before, only MSD messaged me when I quit Test captaincy: Kohli
59.article_body: During a press conference after India-Pakistan match on Sunday, Virat Kohli said out of all the players he has played with before, only MS Dhoni messaged him when he quit Test captaincy. "A lot of [other former] players have my number...A lot of people give suggestions on TV...but no one messaged me," he added, taking a dig at his critics.

60.title: This game was as valuable as a final: Rizwan on Pak's win vs India
60.article_body: After defeating India in their Asia Cup Super 4 stage match, Pakistan wicketkeeper-batter Muhammad Rizwan said the game was as valuable as a final to them. "The whole world [was] watching...we have power-hitters who are capable of hitting around 45 runs off the last four overs. So we didn't panic," he added. Pakistan chased down India's 181-run total to win.

61.title: Road caves in due to heavy rainfall in Kerala's Wayanad, video surfaces
61.article_body: A part of a road caved in, in Kerala's Wayanad district, as heavy rainfall lashed the area. A video of the incident has surfaced. In the video, several people can be seen walking towards the part of the road that got washed away with flowing water. Reports added that all paddy fields have been flooded due to heavy rainfall.

62.title: Fire breaks out at Lucknow's Hotel Levana; rescue ops on, 3 ambulances on standby
62.article_body: A fire broke out at Hotel Levana in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow on Monday. News agency ANI reported that firefighting and rescue operations are underway. Three ambulances and fire tenders are present at the spot. Meanwhile, security personnel are taking the help of oxygen masks to enter the building to evacuate people stuck in their hotel rooms.

63.title: Fire breaks out near Delhi's Chandni Chowk, over 100 fire officers deployed
63.article_body: A fire broke out in a building near the Chandni Chowk metro station in Delhi on Sunday night. Reports said that over 100 fire officers have been deployed and 35 fire tenders are present on the spot. An official said that the fire has been doused and cooling is being done from outside.

64.title: Mistry & Pandoles were returning from a Parsi pilgrimage site when accident occurred
64.article_body: Former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry was accompanied by his three family friends from the Pandole family when the accident occurred. They were returning from a Parsi pilgrimage site in Udwada, where they had gone to offer prayers following the death of Darius and Jehangir Pandole's father Dinshaw Pandole last week. Jehangir and Mistry didn't survive the accident.

65.title: BJP wanted to make RCP Singh Bihar's Eknath Shinde: Nitish Kumar
65.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Sunday said BJP wanted to make ex-JD(U) leader RCP Singh the Eknath Shinde of Bihar and isolate the JD(U) party. Earlier, after the collapse of the MVA government in Maharashtra, Shinde was sworn in as the CM. Kumar’s statement came during the national executive council meeting of JD(U) which was held in Patna.

66.title: Problems of India don't feature in B'wood films now: Pallavi Joshi
66.article_body: Speaking about Bollywood films not working, 'The Kashmir Files' actress Pallavi Joshi opined that the films don't feature India's problems, due to which there is a disconnect with the audience. "If you see the films of Raj Kapoor, Manoj Kumar, Sunil Dutt, they mirrored whatever was happening around in the society," she said. 'The Kashmir Files' also featured Anupam Kher.

67.title: First metro pier comes up inside Bengaluru airport campus
67.article_body: The first metro pier inside premises of Bengaluru's Kempegowda International Airport was cast on Saturday. The 15-km-long route from Yelahanka to the Airport terminal station will have a total of 67 piers. Casting of the first pier, which has a height of 8 metres and a diameter running to 1.6 metres, was completed within three hours, officials said.

68.title: Rohit Sharma's 'angry' reaction to Arshdeep dropping catch against Pakistan goes viral
68.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma's reaction to pacer Arshdeep Singh dropping Asif Ali's catch in 18th over of Pakistan's innings in their Asia Cup 2022 Super 4 stage match went viral. In the video, Rohit can be seen reacting furiously. Asif was batting on 0* when Arshdeep dropped his catch on Ravi Bishnoi's bowling. Asif went on to score 16(8).

69.title: Rachakonda CP calls for cooperation over immersion of Ganesh idols
69.article_body: Rachakonda CP Mahesh Bhagwat on Sunday urged devotees to cooperate with the police to complete the immersion of Ganesh idols peacefully. He also inspected the arrangements for the same at Saroornagar lake, saying that "full-proof" arrangements have been made by police. He added that the police will work round the clock in Rachakonda limits till immersion reach the last phase.

70.title: 'I'm devastated by the horrific attacks', says Canada PM Trudeau as 10 stabbed to death
70.article_body: Canada's Prime Minister Justin Trudeau has said, "I am shocked and devastated by the horrific attacks today in James Smith Cree Nation and Weldon, Saskatchewan, that claimed the lives of 10 people and injured many more." He added, "As Canadians, we mourn with everyone affected by this tragic violence, and with the people of Saskatchewan."

71.title: Virat's form is brilliant, his 60(44) vs Pak was crucial for the team: Rohit
71.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma praised Virat Kohli for his 60-run innings against Pakistan in their Asia Cup match on Sunday. "Needed someone to bat long when the others were getting out. Virat batted with that tempo...Virat getting that score was crucial from the team's point of view," said Rohit. India posted 181/7 but lost the match by five wickets.

72.title: Who are the Pandoles, Cyrus Mistry's co-passengers during the road accident?
72.article_body: Former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry was accompanied by three family friends during the accident. While the car was driven by Dr Anahita Pandole, a top gynaecologist in Mumbai, her husband Darius Pandole, JM Financial Private Equity's CEO, was seated in front. Darius' brother, Jehangir, a top executive at KPMG, was seated in the back and didn't survive the accident.

73.title: BEST imposes ₹3 crore fine on pvt agency for keeping mini AC buses off roads
73.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST) imposed a fine of ₹3 crore on a private agency, two days after 280 mini air-conditioned BEST buses, that have been wet-leased from the private agency, went off the roads. Wet-leased buses are owned by private contractors, who also appoint their drivers and take care of maintenance and insurance of the vehicles.

74.title: 69 fatal spots mapped in Delhi saw 5 accidents per km in last 2 years: Data
74.article_body: The Delhi Transport Department has identified about 69 fatal crash spots across the city. Reports said that these fatal spots have seen more than five accidents per kilometre in the last two years. The data also shows that there are about five corridors which have seen more than two pedestrian deaths per kilometre.

75.title: Cyrus Mistry was not wearing a seat belt, car covered 20km in 9 minutes: Police
75.article_body: Former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry was not wearing a seat belt when the car he was travelling in hit a divider, killing him and his co-passenger Jahangir Pandole, preliminary police probe found. The car was overspeeding and had covered 20km in just 9 minutes, police said. Mistry and Pandole, who were sitting in the backseat, suffered injuries to head.

76.title: 10 killed, 15 hospitalised in mass stabbing incident in Canada
76.article_body: At least 10 people were killed and 15 others were hospitalised after a stabbing spree in Saskatchewan province in Canada on Sunday. Police said they were investigating 13 locations and looking for two "armed and dangerous" suspects. While some of the victims seem to have been targeted by the suspects, others may have been attacked randomly, the police further said.

77.title: 4 members of same family booked for assaulting bus driver in Pune
77.article_body: The driver of a Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) bus was allegedly assaulted by four members of a family in an incident of road rage on Shankarsheth Road in Pune. Police have booked the accused family members, who had also allegedly verbally abused the conductor and ticket supervisor of the bus.

78.title: Rashford scores 2 as Man Utd hand Arsenal their 1st defeat in PL this season
78.article_body: Marcus Rashford scored a brace as Manchester United beat Premier League leaders Arsenal 3-1 to hand the London club their first loss of the season. United's €100m summer signing, Antony started the match and opened the scoring for the home team in the 35th minute. Arsenal's Bukayo Saka equalised in the 60th minute, before Rashford's brace won United the match.

79.title: Pakistan beat India in Asia Cup, record their highest successful T20I chase against them
79.article_body: Pakistan on Sunday handed India their first defeat in Asia Cup 2022 by registering a five-wicket victory in their Super 4 stage match. Pakistan chased down a target of 182 in 19.5 overs to record their highest-ever successful run chase in T20I cricket against India. Muhammad Rizwan top-scored for Pakistan in the match with 71 runs off 51 deliveries.

80.title: Draft order for Gorakhpur changes 'Muslim-sounding names' of wards
80.article_body: A draft delimitation order by UP's Gorakhpur Municipal Corporation has changed "Muslim-sounding names" of wards in the district. Mayor Sitaram Jaiswal said the new names evoke a feeling of pride with Ilahi Bagh now known as Bandhu Singh Nagar, Ismailpur as Sahabganj and other such changes. An official said objections to the order can be filed within a week.

81.title: Back-to-back 50s, this one is better than the other: Mishra on Kohli's 60
81.article_body: Reacting to India batter Virat Kohli's 60 off 44 deliveries against Pakistan in Super 4 stage match at Asia Cup 2022, Amit Mishra said, "Back-to-back half-centuries...this one is better than the other." He tweeted, "Placed his innings with calculated aggression and some good quality shots. GOAT for a reason." Kohli scored 59* (44) against Hong Kong in group stage match.

82.title: Kabir Bedi conferred with Lifetime Achievement Award at Venice
82.article_body: Kabir Bedi was honoured on Saturday with the Filming Italy Movie Lifetime Achievement Award at Venice. Bedi, who has done over six major series in Italy, said not many people realise that "Bollywood and Hollywood are a far lesser part of my life than my career in Italy". He thanked Italians for giving him the opportunity to star in 'Sandokan'.

83.title: My journey is 70% failure, 30% success: Rubina Dilaik
83.article_body: Rubina Dilaik described her journey as a mix of "70% failure and 30% success". She said she believes it is "important to fail otherwise one wouldn't understand the meaning of success". Rubina, who said her priority is to do "impactful work", added that if television offers her "creatively satisfying" projects, she will always choose to come back to the medium.

84.title: You screwed me: Lewis Hamilton to Mercedes on finishing 4th
84.article_body: Mercedes F1 driver Lewis Hamilton went on an expletive-filled rant during the 2022 Dutch GP as he lost his race lead to end fourth. "That was the biggest f**k up. I can't believe you screwed me like that. I can't describe how pi**ed I am," Hamilton said on the team radio. Red Bull's Max Verstappen won the Grand Prix.

85.title: Filmmakers used to call me finest, but nothing translated into work: Shefali
85.article_body: Shefali Shah said that her potential as an actress was "not tapped well" before 'Delhi Crime'. The actress said that while she had always received appreciation, it never translated into work. "There were directors and filmmakers who used to say I am the finest actress but then nothing in terms of getting work," she said.

86.title: Keita, Chamberlain left out of Liverpool's UCL group stage squad
86.article_body: Liverpool midfielders Naby Keita and Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain have been left out of the club's 2022-23 UEFA Champions League group stage squad. Both players are suffering from a muscle injury and are ineligible to be added again until January. Liverpool will travel to Napoli for their Champions League Group A opening match on September 7.

87.title: Azad twisting facts in his favour to befool people of J&K: Congress
87.article_body: Congress on Sunday hit back at Ghulam Nabi Azad accusing him of working at the behest of his "political bosses". Congress general secretary Jairam Ramesh said that Azad was twisting facts to befool the people of J&K. It doesn't make sense for Azad to spread lies in public after parting ways with Congress, he said.

88.title: Ralph Lauren shares pics of JLo's 3 wedding gowns that featured pearls, crystals
88.article_body: Designer Ralph Lauren has shared new details and pictures of the three custom-made gowns that actress Jennifer Lopez wore during her second wedding with actor Ben Affleck. She walked down the aisle in a gown made with over 1,000 hand-cut handkerchiefs using 1,640 feet of fabric. The other two gowns featured silk tulle, pearls and Swarovski crystals, the designer said.

89.title: Haven’t made any monetary gains from ‘Kala Chashma’ buzz: Singer Amar
89.article_body: Singer Amar Arshi said that while his song 'Kala Chashma' is trending on the internet, he hasn't made "any monetary gains from it". He said many people don't even know that the original version of the song, which was released in 1991, was sung by him. "I didn't think the song will become this big," he added.

90.title: Virat Kohli's 6-week-long break has helped him: Ravi Shastri
90.article_body: Former India head coach Ravi Shastri said the six-week-long break Virat Kohli took by skipping the West Indies and Zimbabwe tours has had a positive impact. "Kohli looks a lot calmer, he needed that break," said Shastri. Kohli has scored 154 runs with two half-centuries in the three Asia Cup 2022 matches he has played so far.

91.title: Fundamentalists trying to influence, but Muslims have cooperated: Assam DGP
91.article_body: Assam DGP Bhaskar Jyoti Mahanta said that four main organisations running most of the madrasas in the state have been told to conduct a survey of the institutions within six months. "Fundamentalist forces are trying to influence [Assam's] Muslims...but the community, by and large, have cooperated, with only a minuscule percentage falling prey to the radical doctrines," Mahanta said.

92.title: 13 sand-laden tractors cross Agra toll plaza within 50 seconds by breaking barrier
92.article_body: As many as 13 sand-laden tractor-trolleys of alleged mining mafia broke the barricading at a toll plaza on the Agra-Gwalior highway in Uttar Pradesh and reportedly crossed it within 52 seconds. According to Agra Police, a case has been registered in this connection and further legal action is being undertaken. CCTV footage of the incident has surfaced online.

93.title: 3 labourers run over by train in Punjab's Ludhiana
93.article_body: Three labourers were run over by a train when they were trying to cross a rail track near Dhandari Kalan in Punjab's Ludhiana district on Sunday. The deceased labourers are yet to be identified and all of them died on the spot, a Government Railway Police official said. The deceased labourers were run over by the Ludhiana-Ambala passenger train.

94.title: I am declared dead in govt records, couldn't even withdraw pension: 70-year-old UP man
94.article_body: A 70-year-old man in Uttar Pradesh's Shahjahanpur district claimed he's being denied old-age pension as he has been "declared dead" in government records. "As I'm dead in government records...I couldn't even withdraw money from bank. My cane crop is affected as I couldn't irrigate it due to lack of money," he said. Officials stated that they are probing the matter.

95.title: Incidents happen, where don't they: Jharkhand CM on 14-yr-old tribal girl's rape, murder
95.article_body: Responding to questions on a 14-year-old tribal girl's rape and murder in Dumka, Jharkhand Chief Minister Hemant Soren said, "Incidents happen...where do they not occur?" He added, "Incidents don’t come with a warning." The body of the girl was found hanging from a tree on Saturday. The accused, Armaan Ansari, was arrested on Sunday.

96.title: The view that India shouldn't interfere in world's problems must change: Jaishankar
96.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar has said the idea that India shouldn't interfere if any problem arises in the world, is a "dogma" that must change. "Maybe in 1950-60, we didn't have the capability (to interfere)...But now...we've reached number five in the world in economy," said Jaishankar. An entity ranked number five shouldn't think like one ranked 20, he added.

97.title: Hitting half-century with a 6, King Kohli style: Raina on Kohli's 60 vs Pak
97.article_body: After Virat Kohli hit a 44-ball 60 against Pakistan in the Super 4 stage match at Asia Cup 2022 today, Suresh Raina tweeted, "Hitting a half-century with a six, King Kohli style." "Playing with such calm and aggression at the same time, good going brother," he added. Notably, it is the 33-year-old Team India batter's 32nd T20I fifty.

98.title: Filmmakers making 'bakwas' content, not investing in stories: Prakash on B'wood
98.article_body: Filmmaker Prakash Jha said Bollywood is relying on making remakes. "They are just making remakes. If you don't have [an original] story to tell, stop making films," he said. He added that filmmakers need to understand that they are "making bakwas (crap)" and "not investing in stories and content". He added the makers need to work hard and "think original".

99.title: I can adopt, I can do IVF, I am open to everything: Vidyut on parenthood
99.article_body: Actor Vidyut Jammwal, who got engaged to fashion designer Nandita Mahtani, opened up about his views on parenthood. He said that children are a "divine plan" and he's open to all ways of having a child. "I can adopt, I can do IVF, surrogacy," he added. "If it's meant to be in your life, it'll come to you," said Vidyut.

100.title: 16 idols stolen from ancient Jain temple in UP's Lalitpur
100.article_body: Sixteen idols and their four umbrellas were stolen from the ancient Jain temple located in Paroli village in Lalitpur, UP on Saturday. A case has been registered against unknown thieves and an investigation has been launched, police said. Notably, a team from the Narhat Police Station, personnel from the Special Operations Group and surveillance are being deployed in the case.

101.title: Woman poisons Class 8 boy as he secured more marks than her son
101.article_body: A woman allegedly killed the classmate of her son because he'd scored more marks than her son in the school examination in  Puducherry. The woman allegedly mixed poison pills in a soft drink and gave it to the school watchman, asking him to give it to the boy. The woman has been detained, while the Class 8 boy has died.

102.title: Several injured as Radha Soami followers, Nihang Sikhs clash in Punjab
102.article_body: A clash broke out between followers of the Radha Soami Satsang Beas (RSSB) and Nihang Sikhs in Punjab on Sunday evening, following which around six people sustained injuries, according to police. "No death has been reported so far," Amritsar SSP (Rural) Swapan Sharma said. He added that at least six rounds were fired in the air.

103.title: Yogendra Yadav resigns from Samyukta Kisan Morcha coordination committee
103.article_body: Social activist Yogendra Yadav on Sunday resigned from Samyukta Kisan Morcha (SKM) coordination committee. However, he said, he will be in touch with other movements as well, apart from the farmers' movement. "It is important that the energies of all movements and opposition political parties be joined to fight against the anti-farmer Modi government," he said.

104.title: Radhika Madan's 'Kacchey Limbu' to premiere at 47th Toronto Film Festival
104.article_body: Actress Radhika Madan's 'Kacchey Limbu' is all set to premiere at the 47th Toronto International Film Festival. She shared the teaser of the film on her Instagram handle with a caption that read, "#KaccheyLimbu gears for its World Premiere at the 47th Toronto Film Festival Gala presentation @tiff_net on 11th September 2022." The film is directed by Shubham Yogi.

105.title: Congress' 'Halla bol' rally is 'Rahul Gandhi relaunch 4.0': BJP
105.article_body: As Congress held a 'Mahangai Par Halla Bol' rally in Delhi, BJP spokesperson Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore said, "This rally is 'Rahul Gandhi relaunch 4.0' as no one wants to lead Congress." Rathore added that this rally is meant to save the family and not to protest against the price rise. The rally was addressed by Gandhi and other Congress leaders.

106.title: Mistry desired to keep contributing to India's economic progress: Nirmala
106.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that the death of the former Chairman of the Tata Sons, Cyrus Mistry, comes as a "shock" to her. "He (Mistry) was committed to carrying forward and strengthening his business in infra and infra projects. He desired to keep contributing to India's economic progress. Condolences to his family and friends," Sitharaman said.

107.title: Smart selection: Manjrekar on Hooda's inclusion in India's squad vs Pakistan
107.article_body: Commenting on all-rounder Deepak Hooda's inclusion in India's playing XI against Pakistan in Super 4 stage match at Asia Cup 2022, Sanjay Manjrekar tweeted, "Smart selection by India." He added, "Hooda [is] in to keep depth in batting plus the option of the sixth bowler. No Dinesh Karthik, but Rishabh Pant stays for...left handed element." Hooda scored 16 (14) today.

108.title: Sushant Singh Rajput fan, who threatened to kill producer Sandeep Singh, arrested in Bihar
108.article_body: The police arrested a college dropout in Bihar for allegedly sending threat messages to film producer Sandeep Singh on social media earlier this year. The accused, identified as 21-year-old Krishna Kumar Singh, told police he is a fan of Sushant Singh Rajput and was "apparently angry" with Sandeep for what he had said in the media about the late actor.

109.title: Man who sued Nirvana over his naked baby pic on album cover, loses case
109.article_body: American rock band Nirvana has won the dismissal of a lawsuit filed by a man who claimed that the band using a picture of his naked four-month-old self was child pornography. Spencer Elden was featured swimming naked on the cover of a 1991 Nirvana album. Elden waited too long to allege that Nirvana sexually exploited him, the judge ruled.

110.title: Virat Kohli breaks world record for most 50+ scores in T20I cricket history
110.article_body: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli on Sunday broke the world record for registering most 50-plus scores in T20I cricket history, achieving the feat in the Asia Cup Super 4 stage match against Pakistan. Kohli's 60(44) against Pakistan is his 32nd 50-plus score in T20I cricket. He overtook compatriot Rohit Sharma, who has registered 50-plus scores 31 times.

111.title: You are loved, you are missed: Rakul on Rishi's birth anniversary
111.article_body: Rakul Preet Singh took to Instagram Stories on Sunday to share a post remembering late actor Rishi Kapoor on his birth anniversary. Sharing an old picture of Rishi, she wrote, "You are loved, You are missed, You are remembered, Always." Earlier today, Rishi's actress-wife Neetu Kapoor and his daughter Riddhima Kapoor Sahni also remembered him on his 70th birth anniversary.

112.title: Sorry for what's happened but not our problem: Juventus CEO on Ronaldo
112.article_body: Juventus CEO Maurizio Arrivabene said that they sympathise with Cristiano Ronaldo's struggles at Manchester United but it does not bother them. "We are sorry for what's happened to him in Manchester this year, but it's not our problem," he said. The Portuguese star has started just once in five league games this season and is yet to score a goal.

113.title: People with BJP are 'sadachari', those against are 'bhrashtachari': Bihar CM
113.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Sunday criticised the BJP and said that those that support the party are considered "sadachari" and those who speak against the party are "bhrashtachari". JD(U) charged the BJP-led central government with imposing an "undeclared emergency" in the country, "misusing" probe agencies to silence opposition voices and stoking "communal frenzy" in society.

114.title: Man arrested in Lucknow for marrying woman after lying he's Hindu
114.article_body: A gym operator has been arrested in Lucknow for marrying a woman after allegedly lying to her that he's Hindu. The couple reportedly married in a temple and the woman came to know that the man is Muslim when he forced her to convert. The man also allegedly threatened the woman with dire consequences if she told her family.

115.title: Williams sisters made me believe superheroes are real: Lewis Hamilton
115.article_body: Seven-time F1 world champion Lewis Hamilton said Serena Williams and Venus Williams made him believe that superheroes are real, and they can look like him. He thanked Serena for making him better in every way and said she will "always have a brother" in him. Lewis said he "never dreamed" he would call the sisters his friends.

116.title: Parineeti Chopra to help clean up Mumbai beaches post Ganpati Visarjan
116.article_body: Actress Parineeti Chopra has decided to clean up beaches in Mumbai after Ganesh Chaturthi celebrations. She said every year during Ganpati Visarjan, people "leave behind immense litter" on beaches which ends up in water. "This...can cause mass deaths of...marine animals," Parineeti added while urging people to join her to clean the Juhu beach post the Ganpati Visarjan on September 10.

117.title: I'd love to play for KKR if they build a women's IPL team: Richa Ghosh
117.article_body: On being asked which women's IPL team she aspires to play for, India Women wicketkeeper-batter Richa Ghosh said, "I would love to play for KKR if they build a women's IPL team." She added, "It would be great if they select most of their players from Bengal." The inaugural edition of women's IPL is scheduled to begin early next year.

118.title: Sonali's family writes to CJI for CBI probe, says 'Goa Police not supporting'
118.article_body: Haryana BJP leader and TikTok star Sonali Phogat's family has written a letter to the Chief Justice of India for a CBI probe into her death. "Goa Police is not supporting us...I think political influence is also behind this," her nephew Vikas Singh said. He added they are also waiting for the answer whatever comes from the Supreme Court.

119.title: Injured MP woman carried to hospital on cot for 6 km due to lack of road
119.article_body: Family members of a woman, who was injured due to electrocution, allegedly carried her on a cot for six kilometres to reach the nearest health centre in the absence of a road in a tribal area in Madhya Pradesh's Seoni. "I'll visit Bakharimal village...to take stock of the situation and to ensure easy transportation for the villagers," Ghansor SDM said.

120.title: I really like Rohit as a leader, batter: Waqar Younis
120.article_body: Former Pakistan skipper Waqar Younis said that he really likes Indian skipper Rohit Sharma "as a leader as well as a batter". "It's not that he (Rohit) is playing bad shots. Just that sometimes you aren't able to execute the right shots properly and that's why you end up getting dismissed," Younis said.

121.title: Indian economy will see double-digit growth this fiscal: Sitharaman
121.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Saturday said the Indian economy would see double-digit growth this fiscal. "We (India) have zero percent chance of slipping into recession. I hope for double-digit growth...We are literally the fastest growing economy," the Finance Minister said. Notably, India is currently the fifth largest economy in the world.

122.title: Road crashes claimed 1.55 lakh lives in India in 2021, about 18 lives per hour: Data
122.article_body: Over 1.55 lakh lives were lost in road crashes across India in 2021, marking an average of 426 daily or 18 every single hour. According to government data, this is the highest death figure recorded in any year so far. Besides the deaths, 3.71 lakh people were injured in 4.03 lakh 'road accidents' in India last year, NCRB data revealed.

123.title: Remains of woman believed to be a 'vampire' found in Poland, pics show sickle across neck
123.article_body: The 17th-century remains of a woman who was believed to be a vampire were found by archaeologists in Poland. The skeletal remains were found with a sickle placed across her neck to prevent her from 'rising from the dead', said an archaeologist. A padlock was also seen around the toe of the female who was given an 'anti-vampire' burial.

124.title: Ravi Shastri makes blunder during toss for India-Pakistan match, video goes viral
124.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing Ravi Shastri making a blunder during the toss for India-Pakistan Super 4 stage match in Asia Cup 2022. After India captain Rohit Sharma spun the coin, Babar Azam called 'tails', however Ravi Shastri said in the mic, "Heads is the call," after which the match referee looked confused.

125.title: 17 years ago, I played you and now, I'm interviewing you: Blake to Nadal
125.article_body: Following Rafael Nadal's third round win at US Open 2022, ex-tennis player James Blake tweeted, "17 years ago, I played you on Arthur Ashe Stadium and now I'm interviewing you because you're still one of, if not the, greatest in the world." In the third round at US Open 2005, wildcard Blake beat second seed Nadal 6-4, 4-6, 6-3, 6-1.

126.title: Means a lot to help youngsters: Bumrah on his time at NCA
126.article_body: Indian pacer Jasprit Bumrah commented on his ongoing rehab stint at the National Cricket Academy (NCA) in Bengaluru. "Not long ago, I was on the other side, learning, observing and grasping everything I could," Bumrah said. He added, "Which is why it means a lot...to be able to use the knowledge I have today to help youngsters along the way."

127.title: Bed Bath & Beyond CFO jumps from 18th floor days after announcing job cuts, dies
127.article_body: Gustavo Arnal, the CFO of Bed Bath & Beyond, died after he jumped from the 18th floor of a skyscraper in New York City on Friday, police confirmed. The incident occurred days after the US-based retailer announced plans to lay off 20% of its staff and close several stores. Last month, the 52-year-old executive sold company shares worth $1 million.

128.title: 28-yr-old Karni Sena leader Rohit Rajput stabbed to death in MP, murder caught on camera
128.article_body: A 28-year-old Karni Sena leader named Rohit Singh Rajput was stabbed to death in front of a municipality office in Itarsi area of MP's Narmadapuram district on Friday night. Rajput and his friend were standing in the main market area when three men on motorcycles approached them, leading to a fight. A video the crime has surfaced on social media.

129.title: 2 Odisha forest dept officials suspended after elephant electrocuted
129.article_body: Two officials of the Odisha State Forest Department were suspended on Sunday over dereliction of duty a day after a 10-year-old female elephant was found electrocuted in a village. "Had they been alert, the elephant wouldn't have died of electrocution from the hanging live wire that was set up for [a] wild boar," Dhenkanal DFO Prakash Chand Gogineni said.

130.title: We each stick to our own opinions: Pallavi on political differences with Vivek
130.article_body: Actress Pallavi Joshi spoke about how she deals with political differences with her filmmaker-husband Vivek Agnihotri. "Sometimes we come on the same page. Sometimes we don't. And we each stick to our own opinions," she said. "We're fine with it. We're two individuals and every morning, when we...sit in...living room, we've...tea together, but we don't drink from...same cup," Pallavi added.

131.title: India record their highest-ever score in powerplay in a T20I against Pakistan
131.article_body: India scored 62/1 in the first six overs against Pakistan on Sunday, their highest-ever score in a powerplay in a T20I against Pakistan. Rohit Sharma and KL Rahul slammed a combined 4 fours and 4 sixes in the powerplay. India's previous highest score in a powerplay in a T20I match against Pakistan was 48/1, scored in Ahmedabad in 2012.

132.title: I'm yet to find someone who praised the film: Prakash on 'Laal...'
132.article_body: Filmmaker Prakash Jha has said that it's not the boycott trend that has affected the box office performance of Aamir Khan's 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. He added that a majority of those who have seen it aren't praising it. "I am yet to find someone who has said, 'Wow, what a film it was'," Prakash further said.

133.title: Kvitova saves 2 match points, beats Muguruza to reach last 16 at US Open
133.article_body: Czech Petra Kvitova saved two match points before making a third set comeback to defeat ninth seed Garbine Muguruza and reach the last 16 at US Open 2022 on Saturday. The 21st seed trailed 2-5 before levelling the third set 5-5 and forced a super-tiebreak to win the match 5-7, 6-3, 7-6(12-10) in two hours 38 minutes.

134.title: Hope more talent joins the profession: President on Teacher's Day eve
134.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu on Sunday extended her greetings on the eve of Teacher's Day. She said she hopes that more talent joins the profession. "Our teachers are continuously trying to improve their capabilities and proficiency through new research, experiments and innovations," an official statement from Rashtrapati Bhavan said quoting President Murmu.

135.title: Courts expected to play role of Oppn in certain cases: Ex-CJI Ramana
135.article_body: Former CJI NV Ramana said courts should be dispassionate and in certain situations, they are expected to play the role of or supplant the Opposition. He added that the courts have played an important role in ensuring that constitutional rights are not a dead letter. Ramana said the 1960s and 1970s were the most challenging periods in modern Indian history.

136.title: Pak captain Babar trolled for 'Play confidentially' message to his team for India match
136.article_body: Pakistan captain Babar Azam was asked during the toss by Ravi Shastri about what his message to his team is for match against India. Babar responded, "Play confidentially." Babar was trolled for his response, with a fan tweeting, "Not sure if it's cricket or what." Another wrote, "I hope they play confidentially." "What a start to the match," tweeted another.

137.title: Goa Police visits residence of Sonali Phogat's personal assistant for investigation
137.article_body: The Goa Police, as part of their investigation into BJP leader Sonali Phogat's death, visited her personal assistant Sudhir Sangwan's house in Rohtak, Haryana. The team, after making enquiries at the residence, then reportedly left for Gurugram. It is the fifth day of Goa Police's investigation in Haryana with the team reaching Hisar on Wednesday to visit Phogat's farmhouse.

138.title: If there are fielding restrictions, then no one is as dangerous as Pant: Waqar
138.article_body: Former Pakistan pacer, Waqar Younis said that having wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant on the bench is a "luxury for India". "All of us...were shocked at how he (Pant) is not playing [in India-Pak match]. I personally feel he is best suited in the top-order," Waqar said. He added, "If there are fielding restrictions, there is no one as dangerous as him."

139.title: Does BJP's SOP include barging into ATC Control Rooms?: TMC MP
139.article_body: TMC MP Mahua Moitra asked on Twitter if the "BJP's SOP for bringing down Opposition...now [includes] barging into ATC Control Rooms?" Moitra was referring to BJP MPs Nishikant Dubey and Manoj Tiwari being booked for reportedly pressuring authorities at Jharkhand's Deoghar airport to clear their chartered jet for a nighttime takeoff. Moitra said she knew "BJP's SOP...involves chartered planes".

140.title: Among the best business minds of his generation, called away too soon: Adani on Mistry
140.article_body: Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani on Sunday said he was shocked and saddened to hear about the death of 54-year-old former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry. "One of the finest gentlemen I've known, he was one of the best business minds of his generation," said Adani on Mistry. "It's a tragic loss. He was called away too soon," Adani added.

141.title: Cyrus Mistry's death shocking, loss for entire business world: Maha CM
141.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Sunday condoled the death of former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry, saying it was not just a loss for his family but for the entire business world. Mistry was not just a successful industrialist, but a young and visionary entrepreneur as the business world looked up to him with hope, CM Shinde added.

142.title: Emraan Hashmi to star in Karan Johar’s OTT series: Reports
142.article_body: Emraan Hashmi will reportedly star in Karan Johar's upcoming production venture, which will be helmed by Mihir Desai and Archit Kumar. The suspense-drama series is slated to go on floors this year and will stream on an OTT platform. The series will also reportedly feature an ensemble of actors. The makers are yet to share details on the project.

143.title: GST officers can initiate proceedings in cases of over ₹5 cr evasion
143.article_body: The Finance Ministry has clarified that GST officials can initiate legal proceedings against offenders in cases where the amount of evasion is more than ₹5 crore. It added that the ₹5 crore limit would not apply in the case of a company/taxpayer habitually involved in tax evasion, misusing Input Tax Credit (ITC) facility or fraudulently obtained refund.

144.title: Maha Deputy CM Fadnavis orders probe into accident that claimed Cyrus Mistry’s life
144.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis on Sunday said he has asked police to conduct a detailed investigation into the accident that claimed the life of former Tata Sons chairman Cyrus Mistry. A senior Mumbai police official had said the car in which Mistry was travelling had rammed into a divider on a bridge on the Surya river.

145.title: Kartik Aaryan signs director Anurag Basu's upcoming romantic film: Reports
145.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan has reportedly signed director Anurag Basu's upcoming romantic film. A source told Bollywood Hungama that the film is one of a kind of love story that hasn't been seen in Hindi cinema before. "Anurag Basu's film will give Kartik a chance to extend his performing skills beyond anything he has done so far," the source added.

146.title: 63 pistols seized, 3 arms suppliers arrested by Punjab Police in MP
146.article_body: Punjab Police has arrested three illegal arms suppliers and seized 63 country-made pistols from the latter's possession in Madhya Pradesh's Khargone, an officer said. According to him, 24 cases were earlier registered against the three accused, who used to supply pistols in Punjab and Rajasthan, among other states. Two other persons were arrested last month with four pistols, he added.

147.title: Cyrus was amongst brightest business minds in the country: Rahul
147.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi condoled the death of former chairperson of the Tata Group, Cyrus Mistry, who passed away in a road accident near Mumbai on Sunday. "Saddened by the tragic news...He (Mistry) was amongst the brightest business minds in the country, who made a significant contribution to India's growth story. My heartfelt condolences to his family," Rahul tweeted.

148.title: Thunderous rainfall across Karnataka till September 9: IMD
148.article_body: The IMD has predicted thunderous rainfall across Karnataka, especially Bengaluru, three coastal districts and hilly areas till September 9. Heavy rains are expected for Monday in Bengaluru while a yellow alert has been issued for Kodagu, Shivamogga, Udupi and other districts. Thousands of houses across the state capital have been inundated as CM Basavaraj Bommai visits flood-affected localities.

149.title: Paytm denies links to Chinese loan merchants being probed by ED after raids
149.article_body: Paytm parent entity One97 Communications on Sunday denied having links with the loan merchants that are under investigation by ED in the Chinese loan app case. It said the merchants were "independent entities", a day after ED raided Paytm's Bengaluru office and announced the freezing of some funds. Paytm said the funds frozen by ED don't belong to it.

150.title: Compensate family of those who died of COVID vaccine after-effects: HC
150.article_body: The Kerala High Court has asked the National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA) to frame a policy for identifying and compensating the dependents of those who died due to the after-effects of the COVID-19 vaccine. "Even if the numbers are very few, there are instances where people are suspected to have succumbed to the after-effects of immunisation," the court said.

151.title: India announce their playing XI for Asia Cup Super 4 match against Pakistan
151.article_body: Pakistan captain Babar Azam won the toss and elected to bowl first in their Asia Cup 2022 Super 4 stage match against India. India all-rounder Hardik Pandya, who was rested against Hong Kong, has been included in the playing XI. Deepak Hooda and Ravi Bishnoi have also been included in the playing XI.

152.title: SRK didn't answer, jokes Hasan Minhaj as he poses in front of Mannat
152.article_body: American comedian-actor Hasan Minhaj took to Instagram to share a picture of himself posing outside the gate of Shah Rukh Khan's Mumbai bungalow Mannat. "Pulled up to Shah Rukh's. He didn't answer tho," he jokingly wrote. Reacting to his post, a fan wrote, "Of course you did Hasan. Of course you did. It's part of...India tour...It has to be done."

153.title: Woman sets self on fire in MP, alleges police inaction on rape complaint
153.article_body: A 26-year-old woman sustained severe burns, as she set herself on fire after the police allegedly failed to register a case based on her complaint of rape in MP's Shahdol, an official said on Sunday. The woman is undergoing treatment in a hospital, while Amlai police station in-charge Mohammed Sameer and sub-inspector Savitri Singh have been relieved of their duties.

154.title: Ex-Kerala Minister Shailaja declines to accept Magsaysay Award
154.article_body: Former Kerala Health Minister KK Shailaja has said that she was considered for the Ramon Magsaysay Award for 2022, but she declined to accept it after holding talks with her party, CPI(M). She said, "Magsaysay (former Philippines President) had been anti-communist. I was considered for the award as an individual." She said she has communicated her decision to them.

155.title: Rahul Gandhi says 'Atta cost ₹22/litre in 2014, it now costs ₹40/litre', video goes viral
155.article_body: During the 'Halla Bol' rally, Congress' Rahul Gandhi, while comparing prices of daily use items, said, "Atta (flour) used to cost ₹22 per litre in 2014, it now costs ₹40 per litre." Gandhi, who immediately corrected himself, was trolled online. Reacting to trolling, Congress shared a video of his speech and wrote, "Leave 'litre', take care of the public."

156.title: Versova police take Kamaal R Khan's custody for allegedly molesting actress in 2019
156.article_body: Actor Kamaal R Khan, who was in judicial custody over a controversial tweet posted by him in 2020, has now been taken into custody by Versova police for allegedly molesting an actress in 2019. The actress, in her police complaint, had said that Khan molested her at his house after promising her the lead role in a Hindi movie.

157.title: Haryana man hires UP gang to rob daughter's house, 4 arrested
157.article_body: A man named Sandeep Singh in Haryana hired a gang of three robbers from Uttar Pradesh to carry out a theft in his married daughter's house, police said. Police said the robbers decamped with ₹4 lakh cash and jewellery by taking her mother-in-law hostage at gunpoint. The accused Sandeep Singh, Pankaj Kumar, Kapil and Sompal were arrested by the police.

158.title: I'm told his real name is Aslam, why hide it: Kangana on Mahesh Bhatt
158.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut took to her Instagram Stories on Sunday to share an old video of filmmaker Mahesh Bhatt and wrote, "I am told his real name is Aslam." "He converted to marry his second wife...it is a beautiful name, why hide it?" she added. Kangana made her debut with 'Gangster', which was backed by Mahesh Bhatt.

159.title: NGO involved in Karnataka seer case seeks police protection
159.article_body: Mysuru NGO Odanadi Seva Samsthe, which had filed a complaint against Lingayat Chitradurga math's head seer, has asked the police for protection. The NGO founders said math supporters called them several times and they fear for their lives. Two girls of the math had approached the NGO and alleged that head seer Shivamurthy Murugha Sharanaru sexually assaulted them for years.

160.title: Credit to Manmohan, Narasimha govts for India overtaking UK's GDP: Basu
160.article_body: Ex-Chief Economist of the World Bank, Kaushik Basu commented after India surpassed the UK to become the world's fifth-largest economy. "If anyone gets credit for India overtaking UK's GDP, it's Narasimha Rao & Manmohan Singh's governments," Basu tweeted. He added, "India's growth spurt from 1994 & even faster growth from 2005 made this inevitable, despite the sharp slowdown since 2016."

161.title: CBI raids homes of TMC MLA Subodh Adhikari, brother in chit fund scam
161.article_body: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) on Sunday raided the residences of TMC MLA Subodh Adhikari and his brother Kamal Adhikari in connection with the chit fund scam, in which people were cheated of lakhs of rupees, officials said. Kamal Adhikari is also the chairman of the Kanchrapara Municipality. The CBI raided seven locations in West Bengal on Sunday.

162.title: 50-yr-old man sexually assaults stepdaughter for 5 yrs in Pune, held
162.article_body: The Pune Police on Saturday arrested a 50-year-old man for sexually harassing his 19-year-old stepdaughter for the past five years, officials said. According to the complaint filed by the girl, the accused used abusive language and clicked naked pictures of her, said SB Kadam, police sub-inspector at Sangvi police station, adding that he also followed her to college.

163.title: Launching soon: Peyush on video of cart made by Shark Tank's Jugadu Kamlesh
163.article_body: Lenskart Co-founder and Shark Tank India's judge Peyush Bansal took to Instagram to share a video of a cart for agricultural purposes made by the show's contestant Jugadu Kamlesh. "Launching soon...Bharat K2 - Motorised, Adjustable, Easy to Use, Affordable," Bansal captioned the video. During the show, Bansal offered Kamlesh ₹10 lakh for 40% equity and a ₹20 lakh loan.

164.title: Really tragic Cyrus passed away at such a young age: Tata Sons' Chandrasekaran
164.article_body: Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran condoled the death of former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry, who passed away at the age of 54 in a car accident near Mumbai. "He had a passion for life and it's really tragic that he passed away at such a young age," N Chandrasekaran said. "I'm deeply saddened by his untimely demise," he added.

165.title: Who was driving the car that met with an accident in Maharashtra, killing Cyrus Mistry?
165.article_body: Former Tata Sons chairman Cyrus Mistry was killed after his car hit a divider in Maharashtra. There were four people in the car and Anahita Pandole, a top doctor at Breach Candy Hospital, was driving the vehicle, police said. Anahita and Darius Pandole, the CEO of JM Financial Private Equity, were injured, while another person named Jahangir Pandole was killed.

166.title: Don't miss this contest within contest: Kaif ahead of India-Pak Asia Cup game
166.article_body: Mohammad Kaif took to Twitter ahead of India-Pakistan Super 4 stage match at Asia Cup and wrote, "There are many reasons to watch today's game. For me it's India's top three vs raw Pakistan pace." He added, "Rohit Sharma, KL Rahul, [and] Virat Kohli can tackle speed but with young Pakistan speedsters you never know. Don't miss this contest within...contest."

167.title: KL's role is to anchor innings; just needs couple of more boundaries: Kaif
167.article_body: Former India cricketer Mohammad Kaif said that batter KL Rahul's role is to "anchor" the innings. "Rahul is an outstanding player and doesn't need to change a lot of things...He just needs to score a couple of more boundaries in the powerplay," Kaif said. He added, "Rohit [Sharma] is looking to score quickly so that Rahul can play his game."

168.title: I try to stay in my zone, play the game: Suryakumar ahead of India-Pak game
168.article_body: Talking about his preparations ahead of the Super 4 stage match against Pakistan at Asia Cup 2022, India batter Suryakumar Yadav said, "I just try to stay in my zone...play the game." He added that there have been a lot of talks regarding the India-Pakistan match, with people saying it's the greatest rivalry, but it's like playing just another match.

169.title: 2-year-old girl dies of snakebite in Thane after delay in treatment
169.article_body: A two-year-old girl bitten by a snake died after she allegedly could not get timely treatment in Maharashtra's Thane district. The incident took place on Saturday, following which the girl was taken to the Temba health centre, reports said. The centre is not equipped to handle emergency cases and the girl needed special care, a medical officer said.

170.title: Trump says Zuckerberg came to White House for dinner with him 'last week'; trolled
170.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump was trolled after he claimed Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg came to the White House for dinner last week. "The weirdo...kissed my a** all night...'Sir, you're number one on Facebook. I'd like to congratulate you'," Trump said on Saturday. Twitter users pointed out that Trump left White House in 2021 and that he's suspended from Facebook.

171.title: Give money or else: Video of Kerala boy assaulting family for cash goes viral
171.article_body: A video of a Kerala teen assaulting his family members and demanding money has gone viral on the internet. In the video, which was shot by an onlooker, the boy can be seen yelling and thrashing the windows of his house. The boy can also be seen kicking an old woman and throwing slippers at another.

172.title: I only met Cyrus Mistry once, he was all dignity and class: Harsha Bhogle
172.article_body: Cricket commentator Harsha Bhogle on Sunday condoled the death of former Tata Sons chairman Cyrus Mistry and tweeted, "I only met Cyrus Mistry once. He was all dignity and class." He added, "Can't believe he is gone." Mistry, 54, passed away on Sunday in a road accident near Mumbai after his car hit a divider.

173.title: Shocked & saddened: Vedanta's Anil Agarwal on  Cyrus Mistry's demise
173.article_body: Vedanta's Chairman Anil Agarwal on Sunday condoled the demise of former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry. Taking to Twitter, Agarwal said, "Corporate India has lost a promising son. Shocked and saddened to hear of the untimely demise of Cyrus Mistry. Deepest condolences to his family." Mistry passed away aged 54 in a road accident near Mumbai on Sunday.

174.title: Cong is oblivious; has no vision, policy & no leadership: BJP
174.article_body: The BJP on Sunday mocked the Congress rally against the price rise, saying that the party is oblivious to ground realities, adding that the party has no vision, no policy and no leadership. Congress has lost 90% of elections since 2014, said BJP national spokesperson Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore. Congress' rally is an attempt at relaunching Rahul Gandhi, he added.

175.title: Ashok Chavan denies joining BJP, calls reports 'baseless'
175.article_body: Senior Congress leader Ashok Chavan on Saturday denied rumours of him joining BJP and called them baseless. “I am in Delhi now and will be attending the Bharat Jodo rally in Ramlila Maidan.
