All the speculations about me joining the BJP are baseless. I just happened to be at Ashish Kulkarni’s place when he (Fadnavis) arrived,” Chavan said.

176.title: PM Modi condoles Cyrus Mistry's death, says 'big loss to world of commerce & industry'
176.article_body: PM Narendra Modi expressed his condolences after the demise of former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry. He wrote, "The untimely demise of Shri Cyrus Mistry is shocking. He was a promising business leader who believed in India's economic prowess. His passing away is a big loss to the world of commerce and industry...May his soul rest in peace."

177.title: Aditya's 'Come...' gets standing ovation at US theatre; Vishal shares video
177.article_body: Filmmaker Aditya Chopra's Broadway musical 'Come Fall In Love', based on his 1995 film 'Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge', received a standing ovation from the audience at The Old Globe theatre in San Diego, US. Musical duo Vishal-Sheykhar, composers of 'Come Fall In Love', shared a video on their respective Instagram handles. "Feeling proud as an Indian," Sheykhar wrote.

178.title: Jammu-Srinagar National Highway reopens for light vehicles
178.article_body: The Jammu-Srinagar National Highway reopened for light vehicles going towards Kashmir on Sunday. The highway was blocked at Udhampur due to shooting stones and landslides in the Ramban area after heavy rainfall. Several roadways were waterlogged and commuters were stuck in various parts of Jammu and Kashmir due to rains.

179.title: Vice President urges media to make people aware of organ donation
179.article_body: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar urged religious leaders and media to create awareness about organ donation. “Media and social media have a great role in this mission. Every media person must contribute to spreading this well-meaning message,” Dhankhar said. He also called organ donation a sensitive issue and emphasised the need for creating a support system for donation.

180.title: Cyrus Mistry, who died in a road accident today, lost his father Pallonji Mistry 2 months ago
180.article_body: Former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry, who passed away in a road accident on Sunday, lost his father and construction tycoon, Pallonji Mistry, two months ago. Cyrus passed away aged 54 in a road accident on Sunday near Mumbai after his car hit a divider. Shapoorji Pallonji Group's head, Pallonji Mistry, passed away in late June aged 93 in Mumbai.

181.title: Hard to digest this news: Mahindra after Cyrus Mistry killed in road accident
181.article_body: Businessman Anand Mahindra condoled the demise of former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry. He tweeted, "Hard to digest this news. I got to know Cyrus...during his...tenure as the head of the House of Tata. I was convinced he was destined for greatness. If life had other plans for him, so be it, but life itself shouldn't have been snatched...from him."

182.title: Had brotherly love for Irrfan, we used to play for 3 hrs like children: Deepak
182.article_body: Actor Deepak Dobriyal said in an interview that he had "brotherly love" for late actor Irrfan Khan, with whom he worked in 'Hindi Medium' and 'Angrezi Medium'. "We would spend a lot of time together; his hotel room was next to mine," he added. Deepak further said they used to play for three hours "like children" in the evening.

183.title: RJD leader Vijendra Yadav killed in Bihar's Rohtas district
183.article_body: RJD leader Vijendra Yadav was shot dead on Saturday near Nimdihara Road in Rohtas district in Bihar. According to reports, he was going for farming work when six bike-riding criminals opened fire at him. "One bullet hit the head and one hit the neck due to which he died on the spot," said the police.

184.title: Deeply anguished by sudden passing away of Cyrus Mistry: Piyush Goyal
184.article_body: Union Minister of Commerce and Industry Piyush Goyal on Sunday condoled the demise of former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry. Taking to Twitter, Goyal said, "Deeply anguished [and] shocked by the sudden passing away of Cyrus Mistry." "Indian industry has lost one of its shining stars whose contributions to India's economic progress will always be remembered," he tweeted.

185.title: 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' has given the industry hope: Kiara Advani
185.article_body: Kiara Advani said 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2', which was one of the highest-grossing film of 2022, gave "the industry hope". She said the film's success was "overwhelming" and everyone was "happy with the result". "It was incredible to be a part of a family comedy that also has an element of horror and was part of a well-known franchise," she said.

186.title: Would love to get to 20 years in my career: Ed Sheeran
186.article_body: Singer Ed Sheeran said he wants to complete two decades of his career and announce retirement like Coldplay, which he called "an achievable milestone". He said the milestone "is quite scary" as there is still a long way to go for him, but "U2 and Coldplay are two acts" he looks at "avidly". Coldplay hinted at retirement in 2021.

187.title: Congress leaders go to jail in buses & leave within an hour: Azad
187.article_body: Former Union Minister Ghulam Nabi Azad criticised the Congress and said that party leaders go to jail in buses and leave within an hour. “People from Congress now go to jail in buses, they call DGP, Commissioners get their name written and leave within an hour. That is the reason Congress has been unable to grow,” said Azad.

188.title: Was apprehensive, but my wife convinced me: Dheeraj on 'Jhalak...'
188.article_body: TV actor Dheeraj Dhoopar said he was apprehensive about participating in 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 10', but his wife Vinny Arora Dhoopar convinced him. He said that while the show is out of his comfort zone, it is also the "best way to start" his reality show career. He hoped to emerge as a "better performer" after the show.

189.title: Pics show Cyrus Mistry's damaged car after he was killed in road accident near Mumbai
189.article_body: Several pictures showing the damaged car after former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry was killed in a road accident while travelling from Ahmedabad to Mumbai have surfaced online. According to authorities, his Mercedes hit a divider on a bridge on the Surya river in Maharashtra's Palghar area. There were four people inside the car and two, including Mistry, passed away.

190.title: Will definitely happen: Kamal Haasan on 'Vettaiyaadu Vilaiyaadu' sequel
190.article_body: Actor Kamal Haasan, who was present at the trailer launch of 'Vendhu Thanindhathu Kaadu', said the sequel of 'Vettaiyaadu Vilaiyaadu' will "definitely happen". He said director Gautham Menon "had discussed the gist" of the sequel a couple of years ago, but COVID-19 pandemic "played spoilsport". "We will finalise the project at the earliest," Kamal said.

191.title: Saw myself in him: Rajamouli on ‘Brahmastra’ director Ayan Mukerji
191.article_body: SS Rajamouli said when Ayan Mukerji narrated 'Brahmastra' to him, all his childhood fantasies came alive. He also admired Ayan for the time and energy he invested in creating the film's universe. Talking about 'Brahmastra' and Ayan's dedication, Rajamouli said the filmmaker reminded him of himself when he chose to skip the film's promotional event to complete work on it.

192.title: I-T Department nod not necessary for NDTV acquisition: Adani Group
192.article_body: The Adani Group has said that there's no need to get approval from income-tax authorities for its deal to acquire NDTV. "The IT orders have been issued against RRPR only and for the purpose of securing RRPR's continued ownership over the said NDTV shares," it said, citing a reply received from VCPL. RRPR Holding is the promoter group behind NDTV.

193.title: Activists protest against Maha govt over Metro shed construction in Aarey
193.article_body: Activists in Mumbai staged a protest on Sunday against the state government and the Metro car shed being constructed in Aarey Colony. The protestors said Aarey is a forest comprising wildlife and tribals, hence it should not be cut down. The CM Eknath Shinde-led Cabinet had reversed the previous government's decision and given a green light to the project.

194.title: Uddhav responsible for Ganesh Chaturthi celebration without curbs: Sena
194.article_body: The Shiv Sena on Sunday claimed the credit for the restriction-free celebration of the ongoing Ganesh Chaturthi festival goes to party chief Uddhav Thackeray. Thackeray fought the COVID-19 pandemic for two years with strict restrictions (when he had served as the CM of Maharashtra) and created awareness about the safety protocols, an article in the Sena mouthpiece 'Saamana' said.

195.title: Don't want to put my nose there: Sheikh Hasina on India-China ties
195.article_body: During an interview with ANI, Bangladeshi Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina said "If there is a problem, it is between China and India, I don't want to put my nose there". When asked about Dhaka's relationship with two nations, she said that her main goal is development. "Our foreign policy is clear - friendship to all, malice to none," she added.

196.title: Hamas executes 2 Palestinians for spying, 3 for murder in Gaza
196.article_body: Hamas authorities in Gaza executed five Palestinians on Sunday. Two convicted spies, aged 44 and 54, have been executed on charges of espionage for Israel in 2009 and 2015, according to Hamas-run Interior Ministry. Three others have been convicted of murder. The latest executions, carried out by hanging or firing squad, are the first in the territory since 2017.

197.title: 2 arrested from Gujarat for 15-year-old Mumbai girl's murder
197.article_body: Two men, Santosh Makwana and Vishal Anbhavne, both 21 years of age, have been arrested for the murder of a 15-year-old girl from Mumbai. The two were arrested from Gujarat. Police said Santosh had been in a relationship with the deceased girl. According to reports, the girl's mother had thrashed Santosh after knowing they spent days together away from home.

198.title: My brother Cyrus Mistry passed away, can't believe it: Supriya Sule
198.article_body: NCP MP Supriya Sule condoled the demise of former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry and tweeted, "Devastating news my brother Cyrus Mistry passed away. Can't believe it." "Rest in Peace Cyrus," she added. Mistry passed away aged 54 in a road accident near Mumbai on Sunday after his car hit a divider.

199.title: Pak don't have a player like Hardik, that's India's biggest advantage: Javed
199.article_body: Ahead of India-Pakistan Super 4 stage match at Asia Cup 2022, ex-Pakistan cricketer Aaqib Javed said the "biggest advantage" that India have is Hardik Pandya. "Pakistan doesn't have an all-rounder like that, he's as effective as Abdul Razzaq was for us," he added. Hardik scored 33* and posted 3/25 in India's five-wicket win against Pakistan in group stage last week.

200.title: Pune to procure 0.1 million vaccines for lumpy skin disease: Officials
200.article_body: In an emergency procurement, the Pune Zilla Parishad is procuring 0.1 million doses of vaccines to check and prevent the spread of lumpy skin disease, officials said. Ring vaccination would reportedly be carried out as a preventive measure to ensure that cases of lumpy skin disease are controlled. Notably, two deaths have been recorded due to the disease across Pune.

201.title: Actor Manit loses two flats in Noida's twin towers demolition, says 'It was painful'
201.article_body: 'Kundali Bhagya' serial actor Manit Joura in an interview with ETimes said that he lost two flats in Noida's Supertech twin towers demolition that took place on August 28. "It was painful. I didn’t even see the video of the demolition," said Joura. The actor said that his family initially didn't know there was a case against the structure's developers.

202.title: Diwali deadline for India-UK FTA not going to be missed: Commerce Secy
202.article_body: Commerce Secretary BVR Subrahmanyam told PTI that the proposed free trade agreement (FTA) between India and the UK is in the final stages of negotiations. "There are a couple of areas where we are negotiating...Diwali deadline is not going to be missed," he said. India could see a $10-$15 billion uptake in exports from the FTA, the Secretary further said.

203.title: It's easy to join & leave Congress but difficult to remain in it: Adhir
203.article_body: Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury on Sunday said that it is easy to join and leave the Congress but it is difficult to remain in the party. "Friends come and go in life but life is also like a river," Chowdhury added without naming anyone. He was speaking at Congress’ 'Mehangai par halla bol' rally held in Delhi today.

204.title: Govt mulls over PLI scheme for furniture to boost exports: Report
204.article_body: The government is mulling over a Production Linked Incentive (PLI) scheme for certain types of furniture in a proposal that is at the discussion stage, a PTI report said. The aim is to boost domestic manufacturing, exports and create jobs. The government has already rolled out PLI scheme with ₹2 lakh crore outlay for 14 sectors, including textiles, automobiles, etc.

205.title: He was a friend, a man of substance: Harsh Goenka on Cyrus Mistry's death
205.article_body: RPG Enterprises Chairman Harsh Goenka took to Twitter to condole the demise of former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry. Goenka tweeted, "He was a friend, a gentleman, a man of substance. He was instrumental in creating...Shapoorji Pallonji and ably led the Tata group." Mistry died in a road accident while en route from Ahmedabad to Mumbai.

206.title: Gujarat Titans will definitely retain Gurbaz for IPL 2023: Jaffer
206.article_body: Praising Rahmanullah Gurbaz, Wasim Jaffer said that the 20-year-old Afghanistan opener is an exciting player. "I am sure Gujarat Titans will retain him for the next edition of the IPL," he added. Gurbaz was signed by Gujarat Titans in the IPL 2022, but he did not get a chance to make it to the playing XI.

207.title: Railways to run Onam special trains between Hyderabad-Trivandrum
207.article_body: The South Central Railway (SCR) announced that Onam special trains will be operated between Hyderabad and Trivandrum to reduce the passenger rush during the festival season. The Hyderabad-Trivandrum special train (Train No. 07119) will depart from Hyderabad at 6.15 pm on September 5 and the returning train will depart from Trivandrum at 10 pm on September 10.

208.title: Notorious bandit Sarla Jatav released from UP jail after 17 years
208.article_body: Notorious bandit Sarla Jatav walked out of Uttar Pradesh's Etawah jail after 17 years after Allahabad High Court granted her release. Named in several cases, including murder, kidnapping and extortion, Jatav was convicted and sentenced to life imprisonment. She was only 11 when she was kidnapped by a dacoit named Nirbhay Gujjar.

209.title: Cyrus Mistry, former Tata Sons chairman, passes away aged 54 in road accident near Mumbai
209.article_body: Former Tata Sons chairman Cyrus Mistry passed away aged 54 in a road accident while en route from Ahmedabad to Mumbai. The accident took place on a bridge on the Surya river after the car hit a divider, authorities said. Two other persons injured in the accident have been hospitalised.

210.title: No eggs, chicken in meals for juvenile homes: Madhya Pradesh minister
210.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra said the state will not implement the gazette notification that prescribed serving eggs and chicken in juvenile shelter homes. The notification was issued by the state's Women and Child Development Department on August 25. "This will not be allowed in Madhya Pradesh. There is confusion on this issue," Mishra said.

211.title: Unfinished 9,000-passenger cruise ship may be scrapped due to lack of a buyer
211.article_body: An unfinished cruise ship worth £1.2 billion with a 9,000-passenger capacity may be scrapped before its first voyage. The company that built the Global Dream II, filed for bankruptcy in January and hasn't found a buyer as yet. Its sister liner, the first Global Dream ship, is also up for sale but may not be axed.

212.title: Hatred rising in India, BJP & RSS are dividing country: Rahul Gandhi
212.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, while speaking at the 'Mehangai par halla bol' rally in Delhi, on Sunday said that BJP and RSS are "dividing the country" and creating fear. "Hatred is rising in India. Fear of inflation and unemployment is increasing in India…Only two industrialists in the country are benefitting from this fear and hatred," Gandhi added.

213.title: PM Modi, I'm not scared of your ED: Rahul Gandhi
213.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, while speaking at the Ramlila Maidan during the party's 'Halla Bol' rally on Sunday, said that anger and hatred have increased since the BJP came to power. Further, targeting PM Narendra Modi, he said, "Anyone who raises a voice against Modi is attacked." "I want to tell PM, I'm not scared of your ED," he added.

214.title: Delhi govt schools scores below national average in various subjects: NCPCR
214.article_body: The National Commission for Protection of Child Rights has alleged in its report that the scores recorded by the Delhi government schools in three subjects (maths, science and social science) are below the national average. The NCPCR report claims that government schools in Rajasthan, Gujarat and Madhya Pradesh have fared better than Delhi state-run schools.

215.title: Overflowing Ganga, Yamuna water recede from Prayagraj areas, dirt left behind
215.article_body: Overflowing waters from Ganga and Yamuna rivers have receded from low-lying areas in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj, reports said. However, according to reports, dirt and garbage have been left behind after water has receded. News agency ANI had earlier shared a video of water entering residential areas in parts of the city.

216.title: Opposition will be trapped in the traps they have laid for us: Soren
216.article_body: As legislators of the ruling coalition in Jharkhand are returning to Ranchi from Raipur for vote of trust in Jharkhand Assembly tomorrow, Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren said that Opposition will be trapped in the net they have laid for the ruling camp. Soren will move a motion of confidence in extended monsoon Assembly session to prove his majority on Monday.

217.title: Riddhima pens note on late father Rishi Kapoor's birth anniversary
217.article_body: Rishi Kapoor's daughter Riddhima Kapoor Sahni took to Instagram Stories and penned a note for the late actor on his 70th birth anniversary. "We miss you so much, especially today, but 'with a cheer, not a tear in our eye'. Love you, Papa," she wrote. Riddhima also shared a picture of the late actor.

218.title: 1 dead, 4 hospitalised after toxic gas leak at chemical unit in Maha
218.article_body: A worker died and four others were hospitalised after a toxic gas leak in a chemical unit in Maharashtra's Palghar district on Sunday morning, an official said. Following the gas leakage, the workers present in the unit complained of giddiness and other complications, he said. The incident took place around 7 am.

219.title: Banke Bihari temple to have airport-like queue system after stampede
219.article_body: Days after two people were killed in a stampede in Mathura's Banke Bihari Temple, temple authorities have decided to adopt a new crowd control system. Reports said airport-like queues and barricades will be part of the new system. "People [will] have to follow the barricades and walk in the queue. Barricades will begin from outside the temple," an official said.

220.title: Critically injured python rescued in Mumbai to undergo plastic surgery
220.article_body: A 10-feet-long python fighting for its life because of multiple fractures and wounds will undergo plastic surgery, which could be a breakthrough in treating the critically injured endangered wildlife, officials said. The Indian rock python was rescued by the Resqink Association for Wildlife Welfare (RAWW) and the Forest Department in August, reports said.

221.title: 16-year-old budding athlete killed in Faridabad: 3 arrested
221.article_body: A 16-year-old budding athlete, Priyanshu, was allegedly stabbed to death by multiple men after the former was returning from a sports complex in Sector 12, Faridabad. The police have arrested three men namely Ajay (19), Abhishek (19) and Deepak (25). Notably, Ajay also trains at the same sports complex and had planned to murder Priyanshu over some enmity, police said.

222.title: Pimpri Chinchwad Police keeps close watch on 1,700 Ganesh mandals
222.article_body: The Pimpri Chinchwad Police has asked its personnel to visit Ganesh mandals and keep a close watch in respective station jurisdictions throughout the day. Pimpri-Chinchwad has over 1,000 Ganesh mandals. "One police personnel has to make at least three visits to a Ganesh mandal a day. They have to interact with the volunteers," Pimpri-Chinchwad Police Commissioner Ankush Shinde said.

223.title: Wanted to make it sound funny: Tejasswi on her accent in 'Naagin 6'
223.article_body: Actress Tejasswi Prakash addressed the criticism over her accent in her TV serial 'Naagin 6' and said, "I wasn't following any accent, it wasn't legitimate." Tejasswi revealed that she wanted to make her accent sound "extremely funny". "If people found it funny, that's great. Whatever sells...My show is working even when not everything happening in it makes sense," she added.

224.title: Sex racket operating in guise of spa busted in Pune; 4 arrested
224.article_body: Pune rural police have busted a sex racket that was being operated in the guise of a spa centre in Nanded City on Friday. Acting on a tip-off, police sent a decoy customer to "Blue Berry Spa" in Nanded City destination centre and later they carried out a raid there. Subsequently, four people, including the spa owner, have been arrested.

225.title: Will be disappointed if Kashmir Files doesn't get National Award: Pallavi
225.article_body: Actress Pallavi Joshi, who produced 'The Kashmir Files' in addition to acting in it, said in an interview that the film deserves a National Award. "If we don't get that one National Award, I guess I will be disappointed," she added. Pallavi further said she is aware that the film won't be nominated at any other award ceremony.

226.title: Tribal teen dies in police custody in MP, 5 policemen suspended
226.article_body: A 19-year-old tribal man, arrested in a loot case, died in police custody in Madhya Pradesh's Dr Ambedkar Nagar, police said on Sunday. Claiming that he died due to police excesses, the victim's relatives staged a protest at the police station and temporarily blocked the Agra-Mumbai National Highway. Five policemen were suspended following the protest.

227.title: Silence from B'wood fraternity is deafening: Pak actress Mehwish on floods
227.article_body: Pakistani actress Mehwish Hayat has expressed disappointment towards Bollywood celebrities for their silence on the floods in Pakistan. Taking to Instagram, she wrote the "silence from...Bollywood fraternity is deafening", adding, "'Suffering knows no nationality...or religion' - no better time for them to show us they can rise above nationalist politics and care about their fans in Pakistan."

228.title: Hyd Police busts cricket betting racket, seize ₹1.8 lakh; 4 arrested
228.article_body: The South Zone Commissioner's Task Force, along with Chatrinaka Police, arrested four persons who were operating a cricket betting racket and seized ₹1.8 lakh. The main accused got addicted to cricket betting during the COVID-19 lockdown and befriended the main bookie, identified as Ali from Maharashtra. Ali organised cricket betting by providing applications.

229.title: PM Modi-led govt has 2 brothers, unemployment & inflation: Jairam
229.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh on Sunday said that unemployment and inflation are "two brothers" of the PM Narendra Modi-led government. "We want to send an effective message to the insensitive [PM] Modi government that people are suffering from this back-breaking inflation and unemployment and solutions should be found for them," Ramesh said before Congress’ rally commenced today in Delhi.

230.title: Delhi govt to construct elevated road, flyover, underpass to reduce traffic
230.article_body: In a move to reduce traffic congestion in the national capital, Delhi government will soon construct an elevated road, a flyover and an underpass, according to an official statement. The elevated road will be built on GT Road between Azadpur and Rani Jhansi Road intersection, the statement said. A flyover will be built between Nand Nagri and Gagan Cinema.

231.title: Not psychopath, has criminal mindset: MP police on 'Serial killer Stoneman'
231.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh Police, while talking about the 'serial killer stoneman' who had murdered four guards, said that he is not a psychopath. "He has a criminal mindset. He is behaving like an ordinary person. He is well-versed in social media and knows a bit of English as well. He killed the four to make quick money," an official said.

232.title: 9 migrants die while trying to cross Rio Grande river into US
232.article_body: At least nine migrants died while trying to cross the rain-swollen Rio Grande river near Eagle Pass in US' Texas. Officials from both US and Mexico borders have launched search operations following the incident. Moreover, US Customs and Border Protection said that 53 migrants, including 37 who were rescued from the river, were taken into custody on Thursday.

233.title: Video of Salman Khan putting glass inside his jeans' pocket goes viral
233.article_body: A video of actor Salman Khan putting a glass inside his jeans' pocket went viral. In the video, he can be seen coming out of his car and putting the glass inside the pocket as security personnel protected him from getting mobbed. "What is inside the glass?" a user commented. "He always carries glass of his drink...with him," wrote another.

234.title: Betting on Indian economy to surpass Germany, Japan's within this decade: Paytm CEO
234.article_body: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma tweeted, "I'm betting on us, crossing Germany and Japan within this decade." India surpassed the UK to become the fifth-largest economy, behind the US, China, Japan and Germany, according to Bloomberg. "The timing is so perfect", Sharma added as he shared an article that said India achieved the feat in its 75th year of freedom.

235.title: At least 8 Russian businessmen died in mysterious circumstances since Jan
235.article_body: At least eight prominent Russian businessmen have died in mysterious circumstances or by apparent suicide since late January. While four businessmen were linked to Gazprom or its subsidiaries, two others were associated with Lukoil, Russia's second-largest oil producer. Lukoil's Chairman Ravil Maganov died recently after he reportedly fell from a hospital window.

236.title: Binance identifies 2 suspects involved in $265,000 KyberSwap hack
236.article_body: Cryptocurrency exchange Binance's security team has identified two suspects who may have been involved in stealing $265,000 on decentralised cryptocurrency exchange aggregator KyberSwap, according to Cointelegraph. On September 1, Kyber Network faced frontend vulnerability which enabled the attacker to steal $265,000 in user cash. Binance said it is working with law enforcement agencies.

237.title: MS Dhoni to lead CSK in IPL 2023, confirms CSK CEO Kasi Viswanathan
237.article_body: CSK CEO Kasi Viswanathan has confirmed MS Dhoni will lead the franchise in IPL 2023. "There's no change in our stance. We never said...there will be a change," he told InsideSport. Earlier, Dhoni had said that he would "definitely" play in IPL 2023. "It will be unfair to not play in Chennai and say 'Thank you'," he had said.

238.title: 'Degree holder shoe polish, pakoda stall' put up outside Cong's rally venue in Delhi
238.article_body: Protesting against price hike at 'Mehangai par halla bol' rally at Delhi’s Ramlila Maidan, youth Congress workers on Monday organised a 'degree holder shoe polish, pakoda stall' outside the venue. "Through this symbolic protest, we want to convey the message to our PM who once said ‘fry the pakodas’ on issue of employment," a member of Rajasthan Youth Congress said.

239.title: Muslim man's cab attacked in Hyd, forced to say 'Jai Shree Ram'
239.article_body: A Muslim cab driver's car was attacked in Hyderabad and a group of unidentified men allegedly forced him to say 'Jai Shree Ram', reports said. The victim alleged he was on his way to pick up a customer when a few people started hitting his car windows. "I drove straight past them, but there was a roadblock," the victim said.

240.title: Govt school teachers meet Sisodia, seek assault on them as non-bailable offence
240.article_body: The Government Schools Teachers' Association (GSTA) met Delhi Deputy Chief Minister and Education Minister Manish Sisodia on Saturday. They presented him with a memo seeking legislation making any criminal act or assault on teachers and staff on school premises a non-bailable offence. They also demanded schools with student strength of over 2,500 be run in two shifts for better stability.

241.title: Soldier kills wife, daughter inside Assam Rifles camp in Srikona
241.article_body: A soldier was arrested after he allegedly killed his wife and minor daughter inside a camp of the Assam Rifles in Srikona on Saturday over a family feud, officials said. Following the incident, the soldier escaped and hid inside a temple in the camp. The bodies of the deceased were seen lying in a pool of blood, an official said.

242.title: Delhi govt opens liquor shops at several metro stations, list released
242.article_body: Delhi government's Excise Department on Saturday started selling liquor at shops located at Delhi Metro station premises in several areas. These stations include Dwarka, Karol Bagh, Rajouri Garden and Mundka, a senior Excise department officer told PTI. "Metro stations have...high footfall and that is a big factor in ensuring access to liquor products and thereby more revenue," the officer said.

243.title: Former Punjab CM Parkash Singh Badal hospitalised due to fever
243.article_body: Former Punjab CM and Shiromani Akali Dal's Parkash Singh Badal has been admitted to a hospital due to a mild fever. Badal's medical examination is underway at the hospital, party leader Daljit Singh Cheema said. The 94-year-old was admitted to a private hospital in Mohali in June after he had complained of gastritis and bronchial asthma.

244.title: Musk says Chris Rock invited him to do stand-up comedy at his show; people react
244.article_body: World's richest man Elon Musk tweeted that comedian Chris Rock has invited him to open one of his shows. Several Twitter users encouraged him with tweets like, "You'll do well, Elon...You're pretty hilarious," and "I always thought you were a stand-up guy, Elon!" A user also tweeted "no slapping", referring to Chris being slapped by Will Smith at the Oscars.

245.title: Rublev beat Shapovalov in 4 hours 8 minutes to enter US Open 4th round
245.article_body: Ninth seed Andrey Rublev defeated 19th seed Denis Shapovalov 6-4, 2-6, 6-7(3-7), 6-4, 7-6(10-7) to enter the fourth round at US Open 2022 on Saturday. The 24-year-old Russian won the third round match in four hours eight minutes. Rublev will play against seventh seed Cameron Norrie in fourth round. Norrie beat Holger Rune 7-5, 6-4, 6-1 in third round.

246.title: SRK's 'Baazigar', 'Darr' inspired me to become an actor: Kartik Aaryan
246.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan, talking about what inspired him to become an actor, said, "'Baazigar' and, in fact, 'Darr' too inspired me to become an actor." Speaking of Shah Rukh Khan-starrer Baazigar, Kartik said, he watched the film in his childhood. The 31-year-old made his Bollywood debut in the 2011 film 'Pyaar Ka Punchnama'. Kartik recently featured in 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'.

247.title: Congress was made by us, by our blood, not by computers or Twitter: Azad
247.article_body: Ghulam Nabi Azad, who recently resigned from Congress, said, "Congress was made by us by our blood, not by computers or Twitter." "People are trying to defame us but their reach is limited to computers and tweets. That is the reason Congress is nowhere to be seen on the ground," Azad said during a public meeting in Jammu today.

248.title: 3 arrested for mobile theft worth ₹12.25 lakh at Ganesh festival in Pune
248.article_body: Three members of a mobile theft gang who used to target people during the Ganesh festival have been arrested in Pune. A total of 84 mobile phones worth ₹12.25 lakh were seized from the accused. They all are from Karnataka and had come to Pune especially for the 10-day festival. The accused are aged between 19 and 24.

249.title: It all happened impromptu: Balki on Big B turning music composer for Chup
249.article_body: Speaking about actor Amitabh Bachchan becoming a music composer for his film 'Chup', R Balki said, "It all happened very impromptu." Balki added he asked Amitabh to watch 'Chup'. After watching the film, Amitabh played a tune on his piano. "He was very touched...I asked him if I could use the tune...he immediately gifted it to the movie," Balki stated.

250.title: Afghan national arrested with 4 kg heroin worth ₹20 crore in Delhi
250.article_body: Gujarat Anti-Terror Squad (ATS) arrested an Afghan national with four kilograms of heroin, estimated to be worth ₹20 crore, from Delhi. According to Gujarat Police, the accused, who has been identified as Wadiullah Rahimulla, was arrested from the Vasant Kunj area in the national capital. He was arrested after the police received information about the same from Surat Crime Branch.

251.title: One of the world's most twisted buildings unveiled in China; pics surface
251.article_body: One of the world's most twisted skyscrapers named 'Dance of Light' was recently unveiled in China's Chongqing. Built by architectural firm Aedas, the 180-metre-tall building uses double-curved surfaces on the facades to create an impression that the structure is twisted. According to Aedas, the building has a 'twisting angle' of up to 8.8 degrees per floor.

252.title: Delhi cab driver masturbates in front of 23-year-old UK lawyer, she leaves India
252.article_body: A cab driver was arrested for allegedly masturbating in front of a 23-year-old woman from the UK while ferrying her to a hotel in South Delhi, police said. The incident happened on Friday when the complainant, a London-based lawyer, and her friend booked a cab on an app from Delhi airport. The complainant left the country after the incident.

253.title: Class 11 TN girl delivers & throws baby in bushes; Class 10 boy held for impregnating her
253.article_body: A 16-year-old Class 11 girl allegedly delivered a baby and abandoned him in the bushes near her school in Tamil Nadu's Cuddalore district. The dead body of the baby was found by another student, following which police was informed. The girl told the police that her boyfriend, a Class 10 student in a private school, was responsible for her pregnancy.

254.title: Charges framed against Sanjay Singh in UP over 2008 protest
254.article_body: A local court in UP framed charges against 14 people including AAP MP Sanjay Singh and former SP MLA Anoop Sanda in connection with a street protest against the power department in 2008. The demonstration had reportedly led to a traffic jam with the agitators blocking the road. Earlier in 2008, a case was registered against 36 people.

255.title: NASA's Artemis l mission faces weeks of delay after launch scrubbed
255.article_body: NASA's Artemis l mission's launch could be delayed by at least several weeks after two scrubbed launch attempts. The officials said they will likely have to roll the SLS rocket back to its assembly building to make repairs. NASA Administrator Bill Nelson said if the rollback happens, a new attempt to launch the mission may not happen until mid-October.

256.title: Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant loses external power again: IAEA
256.article_body: The Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant lost external power again, according to the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA). A reserve line continued to supply electricity to the grid. Only one of the six reactors remained operational, the IAEA added. Europe's largest nuclear power plant has been witnessing shelling with Russians and Ukrainians blaming each other.

257.title: Maha tribal woman gives birth in bedsheet on way to hospital, loses baby
257.article_body: A 32-year-old tribal woman in labour was carried to a hospital in a bedsheet due to lack of roads in Maharashtra's Bhiwandi. The woman gave birth on the way but the baby passed away before reaching the health centre which is 1.5 km away from the village. As per villagers, health department staff visited her next day for post-delivery treatment.

258.title: I roped in a Kashmiri tutor for diction: Aparshakti on 'Dhokha...'
258.article_body: Actor Aparshakti Khurana, who will play a Kashmiri terrorist in the film 'Dhokha: Round D Corner', said that getting the character's diction right was important for him. "Kashmiris have a different accent that is unique to them...I roped in a Kashmiri tutor to keep it more authentic," he added. The film also features R Madhavan and Darshan Kumaar.

259.title: Moosewala's parents still getting threats, Punjab govt a failure: Congress
259.article_body: Leader of Opposition (LoP) in Punjab Vidhan Sabha Partap Singh Bajwa criticised Bhagwant Mann-led AAP government and said that the Punjab government is "failure" in managing law and order in state. The Congress leader said that Sidhu Moosewala's father is still receiving threats from gangsters and it appears that the tall claims of the Punjab government were completely hollow.

260.title: India should show more generosity: Hasina on water-sharing dispute
260.article_body: Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina while commenting on the India-Bangladesh water-sharing dispute told ANI, "We're downstream, water is coming from India. So, India should show more generosity." Calling it a "long-standing problem", she said that the dispute should be resolved. "We found that [PM Narendra Modi] is very eager to solve this but the problem is in your country," she added.

261.title: UP man gives wife triple talaq for gaining weight after marriage
261.article_body: A 28-year-old woman in Uttar Pradesh's Meerut has alleged that her husband gave her triple talaq as she gained weight after marriage. In a police complaint, Nazma Begum claimed that her husband taunted and tortured her, and kicked her out of the house. The couple, married for about eight years, has a seven-year-old son.

262.title: Scammer pretends to be Nikhil Chinapa, asks for money from others
262.article_body: DJ Nikhil Chinapa on Sunday took to Twitter to share screenshots of a WhatsApp chat of a scammer who was pretending to be him and asking for money from others. "People I follow on Instagram and who also have a business account are getting messages for money, from a scammer pretending to be me," Chinapa tweeted.

263.title: J&K people will decide name of my party, flag; will be a Hindustani name: Azad
263.article_body: Former Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad, who resigned from the party recently, held a public meeting in Jammu on Sunday. Azad said he will launch a new party soon, adding, "I've not decided upon a name for my party yet. The people of J&K will decide the name and the flag for the party. I'll give a Hindustani name."

264.title: Gulf countries financing 'love jihad' in India: Gujarat BJP MLA
264.article_body: Gujarat BJP MLA Shashikant Pandya in a press conference said that the Gulf countries are financing 'love jihad' in India. The MLA said that those countries provide funds to Muslim clerics in India for the purpose. Notably, various groups held protests in Deesa on Saturday over the conversion of three members of a Hindu family.

265.title: Ali Anwar seeks opposition support for welfare of Pasmanda Muslims
265.article_body: Former Rajya Sabha MP Ali Anwar and chief of All India Pasmanda Muslim Mahaz wrote a letter to the opposition parties, seeking support for the welfare and development of Pasmanda Muslims and other backward communities. “Pasmanda is not just a vote bank, but it is a part of the fight for social justice and equality,” said Anwar.

266.title: It's awkward, think I'm gonna die: BTS' RM on sending message to fans from airport
266.article_body: K-pop boy and BTS' leader RM was spotted at Seoul's Gimpo Airport on his way to Tokyo on Saturday when a member of the media asked him to send a message to fans. RM said, "It's so awkward I think I'm gonna die...It's my 10th year since my debut and it's really awkward. I'll go and come back safely."

267.title: Not every person jailed is criminal by nature, sometimes it's circumstances: Shah
267.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Sunday said the view with which jails are seen in society needs to be changed. Speaking at the inauguration of the 6th All India Prison Duty Meet in Ahmedabad, Shah added, "Not every person jailed is criminal by nature, sometimes it's circumstances which force their involvement."

268.title: 4 Afghan kids playing with unexploded shell killed after it detonates
268.article_body: Four children were killed after an unexploded shell detonated when they started playing with it in their school in Afghanistan's Helmand, police and a doctor said. The children had discovered the ordnance and brought it inside the school, as per a statement by the provincial police chief's office. Three other children were also injured in the incident, the statement added.

269.title: Thousands evacuated as wildfire burns 4,000 acres of land in US
269.article_body: Thousands of residents were evacuated after a rapidly spreading wildfire burnt about 4,000 acres of land in US' California. According to authorities and officials, about 100 houses were destroyed and two people were injured in the wildfire. Moreover, California Governor Gavin Newsom has proclaimed a state of emergency for Siskiyou County. The wildfire had started on Friday.

270.title: China's top legislator to visit Russia for Eastern Economic Forum
270.article_body: China's top legislator Li Zhanshu is all set to attend the seventh Eastern Economic Forum in the Russian city of Vladivostok, official Xinhua news agency reported. Li, chairman of the National People's Congress Standing Committee, will be the most senior Chinese official to visit Russia since the country invaded Ukraine. He will also visit Mongolia, South Korea and Nepal.

271.title: Govt shouldn't run businesses as firms run by them aren't efficient: Maruti Chairman
271.article_body: Maruti Suzuki India Chairman RC Bhargava said the government shouldn't be running businesses as companies run by them "aren't efficient". He added, "[The companies] don't have productivity. They don't generate profit…They need government support all the time to grow." He added, "For most capital investments they need...funds from the government. You can't have industrial growth from taxation".

272.title: Neetu shares pic with Rishi Kapoor on late actor's birth anniversary
272.article_body: Actress Neetu Kapoor shared a picture with her late husband and actor Rishi Kapoor on his 70th birth anniversary on Sunday. Along with the picture, the 'JugJugg Jeeyo' actress wrote, "Happy birthday." Several celebrities, including Kareena Kapoor Khan and Karan Kundrra, reacted to the post. Kareena commented, "Happy birthday, Chintu uncle."

273.title: Be the Union Home Minister: Chidambaram on Narottam's remark
273.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram criticised MP Home Minister Narottam Mishra over “sleeper cells” remark and asked him to be the Union Home Minister if he has more information than Amit Shah. “The MHA once said that the government had no information on the tukde-tukde gang… If Mishra has the information then he should become the Union Home Minister,” said Chidambaram.

274.title: 'We lost ₹225 crore in a day to floods,' say Bengaluru-based IT and banking firms
274.article_body: Bengaluru-based major IT and banking companies collectively lost ₹225 crore due to the flooding of Outer Ring Road on August 30 as their staff were stuck for more than 5 hours, the organisation representing the companies said. The organisation has urged Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai to address infrastructure issues in the city, saying, "Inadequate infrastructure...has now reached a crisis level."

275.title: Look who's grown up and a mother now: Arjun pens note for Sonam
275.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor on Saturday took to social media to share a picture with his cousin actress Sonam Kapoor. The actor wrote alongside the picture, "Look Who's all grown up & is a mother now !!! OMG it's you @sonamkapoor." Sonam welcomed her baby boy on August 20 with her husband fashion entrepreneur Anand Ahuja.

276.title: Halla Bol rally marks the season 5 of 'Rahul Relaunch': BJP
276.article_body: The BJP criticised Congress’ Halla Bol rally and called it an event to relaunch MP Rahul Gandhi. BJP Spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla tweeted that the Halla Bol rally is the fifth attempt of the Party to relaunch Rahul Gandhi. “NASA has contacted Congress to ask it how they managed to relaunch a failed rocket again & again,” said Poonawalla.

277.title: Cannabis plant without flowering or fruiting tops can't be considered 'ganja': Bombay HC
277.article_body: The Bombay High Court while granting pre-arrest bail to a man accused of possessing commercial quantity of narcotic substance ruled that a seized cannabis plant without flowering or fruiting tops does not fall under the purview of 'ganja'. The court was hearing the pre-arrest bail plea filed by Kunal Kadu, who was apprehended arrest by the NCB under NDPS Act.

278.title: Kohli should see till T20 WC 2022 whether T20 cricket suits him: Akhtar
278.article_body: Ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar said he would suggest Virat Kohli to evaluate till T20 World Cup 2022 whether T20 cricket "suits" him. "Kohli's both innings [in Asia Cup so far] were quite patchy," added Akhtar. "When he plays...the longer formats, Kohli will get time to settle," he stated. "I...want him to score...100 centuries and break Sachin Tendulkar's record," said Akhtar.

279.title: China reports 1,848 COVID cases, Shenzhen under weekend lockdown
279.article_body: Mainland China recorded 1,848 new COVID-19 cases on September 3 with 384 symptomatic cases, according to the National Health Commission. The country recorded 1,988 new cases a day earlier, with 502 symptomatic cases. Most residents in the southern technology hub of Shenzhen went into a weekend lockdown on Saturday as authorities began mass COVID-19 testing.

280.title: Changing name of AIIMS would lead to loss of identity: Faculty body
280.article_body: Changing the name of AIIMS would result in a loss of identity of the institution, said Faculty Association of All India Institute of Medical Sciences (FAIMS). In a letter to its members, the association expressed concern over speculations that AIIMS could be named after some famous personality, leader or a freedom fighter. "Identity is linked with the name," it said.

281.title: I don't expect Rishabh Pant to play against Pakistan: Wasim Jaffer
281.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said he doesn't expect Rishabh Pant to be picked for the upcoming match against Pakistan, considering the presence of Dinesh Karthik. Pant wasn't selected for the previous game against the same opposition as well. Discussing the upcoming match against Pakistan, Jaffer stated, "We haven't played the brand of cricket we discuss, that aggressive approach [against them]."

282.title: Hasina thanks PM Modi for evacuating Bangladeshi students amid Ukraine war
282.article_body: Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina thanked PM Narendra Modi for evacuating students of her country amid the war between Ukraine and Russia. "Many of our students were just stuck and they came to Poland [for] shelter. But when you [evacuated Indian] students...they also brought our students back home," she said. She also thanked PM Modi for contributing COVID-19 vaccines to Bangladesh.

283.title: Psychologist sexually harasses female students in Hyderabad, jailed
283.article_body: A Hyderabad-based psychologist was sentenced to 16 days of imprisonment for harassing and making sexual advances towards female students online. The accused conducted counselling sessions in institutions and gave his number under the pretext of sending motivational quotes. However, when students contacted him, he'd harass them and share graphic images in an attempt to coerce them into a sex chat.

284.title: Cong workers gather for Halla bol rally, Delhi police say no one detained
284.article_body: A huge crowd of supporters of the Indian National Congress, on Sunday, gathered at the Ramlila Maidan in Delhi for the 'Mehangai par halla bol' rally. The Delhi Congress took to Twitter to share a video of the crowd. Meanwhile, Hemant Tiwari, Additional DCP of Delhi Police denied the reports of Congress workers being detained.

285.title: 3 booked for posing as Lawrence Bishnoi gang, extorting money from farmer
285.article_body: A man and his two sons have been booked for allegedly posing as Lawrence Bishnoi's gang members and extorting ₹50 lakh from a farmer in Haryana. The victim told police the accused were aware he recently received ₹75 lakh as compensation for giving his land for a railway line project. He said accused threatened to murder him like Sidhu Moosewala.

286.title: The Weeknd ends concert abruptly mid-song after 'losing voice'; releases statement
286.article_body: The Weeknd's concert at Los Angeles' SoFi Stadium was cancelled abruptly on Saturday. "I don't know what just happened...I just lost my voice [mid-song], this is killing me...but I can't give you the concert," he told the crowd. He apologised in a statement and said, "I felt it (voice) go and my heart dropped. My deepest apologies to my fans."

287.title: Firoz Nadiadwala in talks with Anand Pandit for Hera Pheri 3: Report
287.article_body: Film producer Firoz Nadiadwala is in talks with producer Anand Pandit to revive the third instalment of the 2000 film 'Hera Pheri'. "The two have been discussing all the possible...combinations to bring...Raju, Shyam and Baburao back together, however, the things are not there on paper yet," a source revealed. The 2000 film featured Akshay Kumar, Paresh Rawal and Suniel Shetty.

288.title: 26-yr-old MP woman sets self on fire after police refuse to file rape case
288.article_body: A 26-year-old woman set herself on fire at a police station in Madhya Pradesh on Friday, officials said. She had gone to the police station to lodge rape case against a revenue officer. The woman alleged that police did not accept her complaint and advised her to "settle matter outside". The revenue officer was also present at the police station.

289.title: Illness behind 54% of suicides reported in Ludhiana in 2021: NCRB report
289.article_body: National Crime Records Bureau (NCRB) released a report stating illness is the main reason behind suicide by at least 192 people, including 146 men and 46 women, in 2021 in Ludhiana. This accounts for 54% of total suicides reported in the year. In 2021, 307 people, including 71 women, committed suicide in Ludhiana which is 13.5% less compared to 2020.

290.title: 'Did I rape her?' says Karnataka BJP MLA on being questioned over threatening a woman
290.article_body: When a reporter asked Karnataka BJP MLA Aravind Limbavali why he threatened a woman activist in public, Limbavali said, "You are speaking in favour of women. Speak in favour of the people...What have I done? Have I raped her?" A video showed Limbavali shouting at and threatening the woman, who was protesting against the demolition of her property in Bengaluru.

291.title: Who am I to save anyone?: Chhattisgarh CM on housing Jharkhand MLAs in Raipur
291.article_body: Reacting to question of housing Jharkhand MLAs in Raipur to save Hemant Soren-led Jharkhand government, Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Sunday said, "Who am I to save anyone (state govt)?" "They are guests in my state," he added. Earlier on Friday Baghel said that his state will soon witness Enforcement Directorate (ED) and Income Tax (I-T) department raids.

292.title: Two transgender men allegedly harassed, thrashed in Gurugram
292.article_body: Two transgender men who are board members of an NGO were allegedly harassed and beaten up by a man dressed as a policeman in Gurugram. As per their complaint, the man was the father of another transgender man who had taken up voluntary residence at their shelter home in July. The accused allegedly took them to a police station.

293.title: I went through 'tough moments': Nadal on win in US Open 3rd round
293.article_body: Four-time champion Rafael Nadal has now entered the fourth round of US Open, following a 6-0, 6-1, 7-5 win against Frenchman Richard Gasquet. Nadal remains unbeaten against Gasquet having won his 18th match against the latter. "[The] third set (was) a challenge. He increased the level...I went through...difficult moments," said Nadal. "I need to keep going," he added.

294.title: India will be second largest economy in world by 2047: Commerce Secy
294.article_body: Commerce Secretary BVR Subrahmanyam said on Saturday that India will be among the top four economies globally within a few years and the second largest economy in the world by 2047. "There was a time when India had a share of 25% of the world economy. The way India is growing, we will regain the same position," he said.

295.title: Bangladesh's Mushfiqur Rahim retires from T20I cricket days ahead of T20 World Cup
295.article_body: Bangladesh wicketkeeper-batter Mushfiqur Rahim has announced his retirement from T20I cricket days ahead of T20 World Cup 2022. Rahim, who scored five runs in T20 Asia Cup 2022, stated he wants to focus on Test and ODI cricket. Rahim tweeted, "I'll be available to play franchise leagues when...opportunity arrives. Looking forward to proudly represent my nation in the two formats."

296.title: Will object move to build houses on site of Noida twin towers: Residents
296.article_body: Residents of Emerald Court housing society stated they would object to attempts of Supertech to construct another housing tower on the spot of the demolished twin towers and move the court if needed. The nearly 100-metre-tall towers were demolished on August 28 following Supreme Court's landmark order which found construction in violation of norms. Supertech incurred estimated ₹500 crore loss.

297.title: Assam CM shows progress in education sector in video, tags Kejriwal
297.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Saturday shared a video highlighting the state's progress in the education sector. Tagging Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal in the Twitter post, he said, "Unless forced to, we prefer to work quietly!" This comes days after Kejriwal shared a news report which said 34 schools in Assam were closed due to poor results in exams.

298.title: AAP MLAs attend parents-teachers meetings in Ludhiana govt schools
298.article_body: AAP MLAs attended parents-teachers meetings held in government schools in their respective constituencies in Punjab's Ludhiana on Saturday. The MLAs, like Sarvjit Kaur Manuke, Rajinderpal Kaur Chhina, etc, interacted with the students, teachers and parents to check the quality of education being provided there. Moreover, the MLAs called the teachers "nation builders".

299.title: She bounced back in 10 months: Zerodha Co-founder on pic with wife after cancer diagnosis
299.article_body: Sharing an update on his wife's cancer recovery journey, Zerodha Co-founder Nithin Kamath posted a photo of them rock climbing. He wrote, "Seema has bounced back in just 10 months since her breast cancer diagnosis, the mastectomy, chemotherapy, and radiation, thanks to her healthy lifestyle before and after." Seema Patil was diagnosed with breast cancer in November.

300.title: CPI(M) leaders meet T'gana CM KCR, extend support to fight against hatred
300.article_body: Members of Communist Party of India (Marxist) met Telangana CM KCR and extended their support in fight against the forces of religious hatred. “The CM also thanked the CPI(M) party for coming forward in response to his call to unite the democratic supporters, intellectuals and political leaders representing the civil society to prevent the conspiracies of divisive forces,” CMO said.

301.title: Germany pledges $199 million for internally displaced Ukrainians: Report
301.article_body: German Development Minister Svenja Schulze has said that the government will provide Ukraine with $199 million to assist internally displaced people, reports said. "The money...intends to...ensure that the displaced people in Ukraine can...provide themselves with the most basic necessities," she added. Around 7 million people have been internally displaced in Ukraine since the war began.

302.title: We'll keep raising voices against inflation, king will have to listen: Rahul
302.article_body: Ahead of Congress’ 'Mehangai par halla bol’ rally in Delhi on Sunday, party leader Rahul Gandhi said the public today has to think ten times before buying essential things. "Only PM is responsible for these problems," Rahul tweeted. Furthermore, he said that his party will keep raising voices against inflation. "The king will have to listen," Rahul added.

303.title: Zuckerberg shares video of him training with MMA fighter Khai Wu, people react
303.article_body: Meta's billionaire CEO Mark Zuckerberg took to Instagram to share a video of him training with MMA fighter Khai Wu ahead of the 27-year-old's UFC Fight Pass debut. Conor McGregor reacted saying, "Yo!!! F****** awesome Mark!", while a creator asked, "Can I unlock these skills in metaverse?" Another user wrote, "[Wu] does not wanna hit Zuck and lose his account."

304.title: BJP MP’s action at Deoghar airport equivalent to a terrorist act: Congress
304.article_body: Congress MP Imran Pratapgarhi criticised BJP MP Nishikant Dubey over Deoghar airport incident and compared it to a terrorist act. “The way Dubey created ruckus in ATC is equal to a terrorist act...An MP should have followed the law but he is flouting it openly. Strict action should be taken against the MPs involved in it,” said Imran.

305.title: Amit Shah to visit Mumbai for Ganeshotsav today, traffic police issues advisory
305.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah will be visiting Mumbai for Ganeshotsav, Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis said. Shah is expected to visit Lalbaugcha Raja pandal, another BJP leader said. Meanwhile, the Mumbai Traffic Police issued an advisory stating that traffic movement will be slow at some places on 4th and 5th of September due to VVIP visit in the city.

306.title: Why are thousands of Czech people from far-right & far-left protesting against govt?
306.article_body: Almost 70,000 people from the far-right and far-left protested against the Czech government in Prague on Saturday. The protest highlighted rising inflation and rise in energy prices amid Russia-Ukraine war. The protesters said the Czech Republic should be neutral and condemned the government for supporting sanctions against Russia, accusing it of being unable to cope with soaring energy prices.

307.title: Redemption for Afghanistan getting us out for 105: Bhanuka on SL's win
307.article_body: Sri Lanka batter Bhanuka Rajapaksa said his team wanted to show the "entire world" during their four-wicket win against Afghanistan, that they're "not as bad" as they seemed when bowled out for 105 earlier against Afghanistan. "It was...redemption," added Bhanuka. Afghanistan batter Rahmanullah Gurbaz recorded the highest score in men's T20 Asia Cup history during the match, following his 84(45).

308.title: MobiKwik reports ₹540 crore revenue in FY22, registers 80% growth
308.article_body: Fintech startup MobiKwik has reported a revenue of ₹540 crore for FY22, registering an 80% year-on-year growth over the previous financial year. The firm's contribution margin rose to ₹147 crore from ₹40 crore reported in FY21. The payments platform of the fintech startup added 2.2 crore users, taking the total number of users to around 12.7 crore.

309.title: HC dismissed plea challenging support to wife, says man's duty to provide
309.article_body: Punjab and Haryana High Court dismissed a man's plea seeking quashing of a Family Court order granting interim maintenance of ₹3,000 per month to his wife. Citing a Supreme Court judgment, the court held "woman has right of same living standard which she [enjoyed] while living with...husband." HC stated husband is legally and morally responsible to look after his wife.

310.title: Today's rally has nothing to do with state polls or 2024 election: Cong's Jairam
310.article_body: Ahead of Congress' 'Mehangai par halla bol' rally that will be held in the national capital on Sunday, Congress’ Jairam Ramesh said, "Today's halla bol rally has nothing to do with state elections or 2024 election." He added, "It’s a befitting message to insensitive central government as people of country remain troubled by inflation...unemployment."

311.title: Brahmastra makers lose ₹1.5 crore after event gets cancelled in Hyderabad: Report
311.article_body: A pre-release event for upcoming film Brahmastra with Jr NTR as the chief guest was cancelled at the last minute in Hyderabad after police permission for the event was denied, according to reports. The makers reportedly incurred a loss of ₹1.5 crore due to the cancellation. The film is slated to release on September 9.

312.title: EV charging points made mandatory for new buildings in Pune
312.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has made it mandatory for new buildings in the city to have charging facilities for electric vehicles (EVs). As per the new order, 20 percent of the total parking spaces should be reserved for electric vehicles in all commercial as well as residential buildings that have parking space for 20 or more four-wheelers.

313.title: Story of IITs is story of Independent India: President Droupadi Murmu
313.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu said that in more than one way, the story of the IITs is the story of Independent India. Speaking at the closing ceremony of Diamond Jubilee celebrations of IIT Delhi on Saturday, the President said, "IITs have been pride of the nation...IITs proved to the world the capability of India in the domains of education and technology."

314.title: 26-yr-old baggage handler dies after her hair gets stuck in conveyor belt at US airport
314.article_body: A 26-year-old baggage handler at the New Orleans International Airport in the US died after her hair got caught in a conveyer belt recently. The baggage handler was unloading bags from a Frontier Airlines flight on the tarmac when the incident took place, officials said. She was rushed to a hospital but died due to her injuries.

315.title: IMD issues yellow alert for 10 districts of Himachal Pradesh
315.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a yellow alert for 10 districts of Himachal Pradesh till Sunday. The districts include Bilaspur, Hamirpur, Shimla, Kangra, Mandi and Kullu. The IMD has also warned of heavy rains and flash floods in the state. On Friday, several houses and shops were destroyed in Dharamshala following a cloudburst.

316.title: UK billionaire says WFH employees are 'lazy gits' who should be 'paid less'
316.article_body: British billionaire Alan Sugar was criticised after he remarked that work-from-home employees should be "paid less" as they save travel costs. Commenting after a discussion on a talk show, the 75-year-old also described remote workers as "lazy gits" who watch "golf and tennis" at home instead of working. "Get them back to the office or fire them," said Sugar.

317.title: KTR says Hyd's Gandipet park is ready for inauguration, shares pics
317.article_body: Telangana Municipal Administration and Urban Development Minister KT Rama Rao on Saturday tweeted, "Gandipet park development by Hyderabad Metropolitan Development Authority is ready for inauguration." He also shared pictures of the same, saying that the park will be a "nice [and] new addition to greening the beautiful city of Hyderabad". He added that the park will have an amphitheatre.

318.title: It's a big burden, we have 1.1 million Rohingyas: Bangladesh PM
318.article_body: Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina in an interview told ANI that the country has 1.1 million Rohingya migrants and it is a "big burden". She said that the country is consulting with the international community and its neighbouring countries so that the Rohingyas can go back home. "India as a neighbour country...can play a big role [in] it," she added.

319.title: Will hand over ₹15 lakh cash prize to parents: Superstar Singer 2 winner
319.article_body: Mohammad Faiz, who was named the winner of 'Superstar Singer 2', has said that he is "grateful" for the love and fame he received through this show. Speaking about the ₹15 lakh cash prize he received along with the trophy, the 14-year-old said, "I will hand it over to my parents because I participated in the show for them only."

320.title: Disagree with Akram's remark that Rizwan should've got out vs HK: Inzamam
320.article_body: Former Pakistan captain Inzamam-ul-Haq said he disagrees with ex-Pakistan pacer Wasim Akram's remark that Muhammad Rizwan should have got "out", rather than remaining unbeaten during his 78 against Hong Kong. "Rizwan going not out...was a big no-no. If you're there, try to hit a couple of fours, get out...What's the point in this format going not out," Akram had said.

321.title: Meeting & talking to people from political parties doesn't change one's DNA: Azad
321.article_body: Ghulam Nabi Azad, who recently resigned from Congress, on Saturday said meeting people from other political parties and talking to them does not change the DNA of a person. "MPs from 22 parties spoke about me (on my farewell) but only what the PM said was highlighted," Azad added. Earlier, Congress’ Jairam Ramesh said, "GNA's (Azad) DNA has been 'Modi-fied'."

322.title: Bengaluru police arrest car and sandalwood thieves, recover 9 cars
322.article_body: Bengaluru police have arrested nine people in two cases related to car and sandalwood theft. Police seized 147 litres of sandalwood oil and 730 kilograms of sandalwood worth ₹3 crore. The police also got hold of a duo who operate across Delhi and Bengaluru. They recovered nine cars which included luxury models valued at around ₹1.2 crore.

323.title: Moody's is irrelevant: Musk after agency downgrades Tesla's credit rating
323.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk remarked on Twitter that "Moody's is irrelevant." Musk's tweet came in response to a Twitter user who shared a screenshot of an email that detailed the reasons for downgrading Tesla's credit rating. In the email, Moody's analyst Rene Lipsch clarified that the reasons for Tesla's rating are more qualitative rather than quantitative in nature.

324.title: FM lowering her level: T'gana minister on Sitharaman's demand for PM's pic
324.article_body: Telangana Health Minister Harish Rao criticised Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman after she scolded a Collector over the absence of PM Narendra Modi's photos at fair price shops. "I don't understand why the Union Minister keeps degrading her level. When she is talking about PM photos not being there…she is bringing down the Prime Minister's level," Rao said.

325.title: India's 1st 'Night Sky Sanctuary' to be set up in Ladakh in next 3 months: Govt
325.article_body: The Department of Science & Technology (DST) has undertaken to set up India's first-ever 'Night Sky Sanctuary' in Ladakh which will be completed within the next three months. The proposed Dark Sky Reserve will be located in Ladakh's Hanle. It will boost astro-tourism in India and will be one of the world's highest-located sites for optical, infrared and gamma-ray telescopes.

326.title: I get messages like 'You don't look old', sometimes I get 'Act your age': Sophie
326.article_body: Speaking about ageism, actress Sophie Choudry stated she gets messages where people tell her they were in school when her music video 'Ek Pardesi' came out and they look old but she doesn't. "Once in a while, I get messages...telling me to 'act my age' but what's that?" she added. Sophie said she never thought of age as a number.

327.title: We're not in 'Woods' anymore, films will now be Indian cinema: Johar
327.article_body: During a promotional event for the film 'Brahmastra', filmmaker Karan Johar said, "We keep giving it (films) 'wood', Tollywood, Bollywood. But we are not up in the woods anymore." He added that they are now out of the 'woods' and are proudly part of Indian cinema. "Each and every film will now be from Indian cinema," Johar further stated.

328.title: India only play in Dubai, are they afraid of Sharjah?: Ex-Pak bowler Bakht
328.article_body: Ex-Pakistan bowler Sikander Bakht said India "only play" in Dubai, going on to question if they're "afraid" of playing in Sharjah. "India were scheduled to play against Pakistan in Sharjah. You guys changed it to Dubai," added Bakht. "That ground's been pretty bad for us...We're in strong favours with...ICC, so we're not playing there," jokingly reacted ex-India cricketer Atul Wassan.

329.title: Alleged Al-Qaeda member arrested in Mumbai's Bandra
329.article_body: The Maharashtra Anti-Terrorism Squad and the West Bengal Special Task Force (STF) arrested a person from Bandra East for suspected terror links. The accused has been identified as Saddam Hussain Khan and is suspected to be a member of Al-Qaeda in the Indian Subcontinent (AQIS). He is accused of radicalising young men and recruiting for the terror outfit.

330.title: Delhi Police share traffic advisory in view of Congress' 'Mehangai par halla bol' rally
330.article_body: Delhi Traffic Police have shared advisory for commuters in view of Congress' 'Mehangai par halla bol' rally that will be held in the national capital today. Ranjit Singh Flyover from Barakhamba Road to Guru Nanak Chowk, Vivekanand Marg, JLN Marg (Delhi Gate to Guru Nanak Chowk), roundabout Kamla Market to Guru Nanak Chowk and Chaman Lal Marg will remain closed.

331.title: Hyderabad's Cyberabad sub-inspector jailed for 2 yrs for taking bribe
331.article_body: The First Additional Special Judge for SPE & ACB cases convicted a sub-inspector posted in Hyderabad's Cyberabad Police Station to two years of imprisonment and imposed a fine of ₹5,000 for accepting bribe. The accused K Rajendra was trapped by Anti Corruption Bureau while demanding and accepting a bribe of ₹10,000 from complainant for releasing motor vehicle detained by him.

332.title: One of the world's oldest zoos in Bristol shuts down after 186 years
332.article_body: Bristol Zoo Gardens, one of the world's oldest zoos, welcomed visitors for the last time on Saturday as it shut down after 186 years. The zoo claims to have welcomed 9 crore visitors since it opened in 1836 and helped save 175 species from extinction. Notably, the zoo was home to the first-ever rare black rhino born in the UK.

333.title: Javed Akhtar may be communist but wrote bhajans in Lagaan in pure Hindi: Vivek
333.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' director Vivek Agnihotri, speaking about lyricist Javed Akhtar, has said, "Even a man like Javed, the bhajans he wrote for 'Lagaan' were pure Hindi." He further called Javed "well-read, intelligent" and a person who is tied to Indian roots. "He may be a communist, he may fight against the right-wing, it doesn't matter," Vivek concluded.

334.title: Man out on bail throws acid on woman in UP; woman escapes unhurt
334.article_body: A female 'lekhpal', a revenue official, escaped unhurt after a 30-year-old man threw acid on her in Uttar Pradesh's Agra, police said on Friday. The accused, who's on the run, had previously assaulted the official a year ago and was out on bail in the case, police added. The official was on her way to work when the incident occurred.

335.title: 2 arrested for 'hookah, non-veg boat party' on river Ganga in Uttar Pradesh
335.article_body: Two of eight youths who were seen smoking hookah and roasting meat on boats over Ganga river in Daraganj area of Uttar Pradesh were arrested on Saturday. The youths have been identified as 25-year-old Mohd Asif and 30-year-old Hassan Ahmad. "They are...being questioned so as to identify other six youths who were with them during the boat ride," police said.

336.title: UP preferred destination for investors due to improved law & order: CM Yogi
336.article_body: CM Yogi Adityanath on Saturday said that Uttar Pradesh has become the preferred destination for investors because of improved law and order which has changed UP’s earlier image. "No riots took place in the last five-and-a-half years. The state is receiving huge investments and employment opportunities are being generated," CM Yogi added.

337.title: Barack Obama wins Emmy for narration in 'Our Great National Parks' documentary
337.article_body: Former US President Barack Obama was awarded an Emmy for narrating in Netflix documentary series 'Our Great National Parks', the Television Academy announced. "The 44th US President is now an Emmy winner for Outstanding Narrator," the Television Academy tweeted. Obama had already won Grammy Awards for audio versions of his memoirs 'The Audacity of Hope' and 'Dreams from My Father'.

338.title: Pakistani terrorist captured days ago dies of cardiac arrest in J&K
338.article_body: A Pakistani terrorist who was captured during an infiltration attempt about a fortnight ago died of cardiac arrest in Jammu and Kashmir's Rajouri district on Saturday, said officials. A trained Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) terrorist, 32-year-old Tabarak Hussain underwent surgery at a military hospital after he was critically injured by the Indian Army, according to officials.

339.title: Mumbai witnesses heavy rainfall and thunderstorms; people share pics, videos
339.article_body: Mumbai, on Sunday, witnessed heavy rainfall and thunderstorms. Several residents of the city took to Twitter to share pictures and videos of the weather. "Another round of crazy thunderstorms going on...since 7:30 am," one user wrote. Meanwhile, another wrote, "Sounds like thor is coming [to] Mumbai." "Can't get lovelier than this," a twitter user wrote while sharing a video.

340.title: 20-yr-old Rahmanullah smashes highest score in T20 Asia Cup history, breaks Rohit's record
340.article_body: Afghanistan's 20-year-old opener Rahmanullah Gurbaz on Saturday night recorded the highest score in men's T20 Asia Cup history. Rahmanullah scored 84(45), including four fours and six sixes, against Sri Lanka in the first Super 4 stage match of Asia Cup 2022. The previous record was held by Rohit Sharma, who slammed 83 runs off 55 deliveries against Bangladesh in 2016.

341.title: Insurance agents in Mumbai booked for cheating 1,129 policyholders
341.article_body: Tata AIG General Insurance company filed a police complaint in Mumbai against a group of more than 10 insurance agents for cheating 1,129 policyholders of the company and causing a loss of ₹1.53 crore to the company. The accused would collect the four-wheelers' insurance premium from policy buyers and deposit the two-wheelers' premium with the insurance company, the police said.

342.title: US' Death Valley breaks record for hottest September day anywhere on planet, hits 53°C
342.article_body: US' Death Valley National Park broke the record for the hottest September day anywhere on planet after its Furnace Creek thermometer hit nearly 53°C (127°F) on Thursday. This comes less than a month after monsoon rain caused flash flooding in Death Valley, damaging several roads. Death Valley holds the world record for hottest temperature at 56.7°C, measured in July 1913.

343.title: India reports 6,809 new COVID-19 cases in 24 hours, positivity rate at 2.12%
343.article_body: India has reported 6,809 new COVID-19 cases and 21 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Health Ministry. Additionally, five reconciled deaths from earlier period were added in Kerala. This comes a day after the country recorded 7,219 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in the country dropped to 55,114, while the daily positivity rate stood at 2.12%.

344.title: Don't use unacceptable language against Mamata: TMC MP to Opposition
344.article_body: TMC MP Saugata Roy has warned Opposition leaders against using "unacceptable language" against West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee. "If you (Opposition) call Mamata Banerjee the queen of thieves, be ready for a hard blow on your back," said Roy. "If you call her the queen of corruption, you never know how our party workers will react in anger," he added.

345.title: 1 dead on Kinnaur-Chitkul trek, search ops ordered for 5 missing people
345.article_body: One person died while five others went missing while they were on the Kinnaur-Chitkul trek. The five missing people include two trekkers and three porters. They were reportedly trekking from Khimloga Pass in Uttarakhand towards Himachal. The Disaster Management Authority of Himachal Pradesh has ordered a search and rescue operation for the missing trekkers and porters.

346.title: India set to become the 3rd largest economy in world by 2029: SBI report
346.article_body: The Indian economy is set to become the third largest economy in the world by 2029, an SBI research report has found. India is currently the world's fifth largest economy after overtaking the UK. According to the SBI report, India is on pace to pip Germany in 2027 and Japan by 2029, at its current rate of growth.

347.title: Tommy Hilfiger, Calvin Klein owner announces plan to fire 10% staff globally
347.article_body: PVH Corp, the owner of brands like Calvin Klein and Tommy Hilfiger, has announced job cuts. The company said it planned "to reduce people costs in its global offices by approximately 10%" by the end of the next year to streamline the organisation and improve efficiency. It also said that it expected a revenue decline this year.

348.title: BJP won’t be able to stop JD(U) from becoming national party: Lalan Singh
348.article_body: JD(U) chief Lalan Singh said whatever "tricks" the BJP may play, it won’t be able to stop JD(U) from becoming a national party by 2023. "The BJP should worry about itself...They should think of their fate in 2024 when the entire Opposition will stand united against them," Singh added. His statement came after five JD(U) MLAs joined BJP in Manipur.

349.title: ₹2.3-crore Bentley car stolen from London found during raid in Pakistan; pic viral
349.article_body: Bentley Mulsanne, which was allegedly stolen from the UK's London, was recovered during a raid conducted by the customs department in Pakistan's Karachi. People involved in the whole racket managed to import the car to Pakistan using documents of a top diplomat of an east European country, according to reports. The vehicle costs more than $300,000 (around ₹2.3 crore).

350.title: Layoffs a chance to prove haters wrong, says Snap CEO amid 20% job cuts: Report
