350.article_body: In a meeting held with employees after he confirmed 20% job cuts, Snap CEO Evan Spiegel reportedly said that while this was a setback, it was a chance to "prove the haters wrong". Some employees said that the alleged statement didn't help the meeting's tone and mood. Snap is laying off around 1,200 employees to reduce costs amid weak revenue.

351.title: 'Brahmāstra' sells over 27,000 tickets via advance booking: Report
351.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Brahmāstra: Part One – Shiva' has sold over 27,000 tickets at three national chains through advance booking within 24 hours, reported Pinkvilla. The film has sold more tickets through advance booking than the Hindi version of SS Rajamouli's 'RRR', the report added. 'Brahmāstra: Part One – Shiva' will mark Ranbir and Alia's first film together.

352.title: Japan 'declares war' on floppy discs, plans to phase out retro tech
352.article_body: Japan's Digital Minister Taro Kono has "declared a war" on floppy discs and other retro technology used in the country and is looking to phase them out. Around 1,900 government procedures still require businesses to use floppy discs, CDs and mini-discs, the Minister noted. At a recent conference, he asked, "Where does one even buy a floppy disc these days?"

353.title: Excited to be working with Kartik Aaryan again: Kiara on 'SatyaPrem...'
353.article_body: Actress Kiara Advani opened up about working with actor Kartik Aaryan in the film 'SatyaPrem Ki Katha' after the success of 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'. "I'm excited to be working with him once again! It's a love story, my favourite genre, where I play Katha, and he plays Satya," she stated. "Fortunately, our pairing...worked well in 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'," she added.

354.title: US' Death Valley breaks record for hottest September day anywhere on planet, hits 53°C
354.article_body: US' Death Valley National Park broke the record for the hottest September day anywhere on planet after its Furnace Creek thermometer hit nearly 53°C (127°F) on Thursday. This comes less than a month after monsoon rain caused flash flooding in Death Valley, damaging several roads. Death Valley holds the world record for hottest temperature at 56.7°C, measured in July 1913.

355.title: My films aren't working as Kapil Sharma jinxes it, jokes Akshay Kumar
355.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar appeared in 'The Kapil Sharma Show' to promote his film 'Cuttputlli' along with Rakul Preet Singh. In the promo of the episode, Kapil asked him, "Brother, how do you turn a year younger on every birthday?" To this, Akshay jokingly replied, "Kapil jinxes everything I do, my films, my money...now none of my films are working."

356.title: Congress vanishing from country, world getting rid of communist parties: Shah
356.article_body: Union Minister Amit Shah said the Congress is vanishing from the country and the world is getting rid of communist parties. "If Kerala has a future, it's BJP. The [PM] Modi regime can bring much-needed change in the state," Shah added. "The Congress party and Communists never worked for the welfare of the Scheduled Tribes and the poor," Shah stated.

357.title: Man who cheated woman on promise of marriage held: Rachakonda Police
357.article_body: Cybercrime police have arrested a 31-year-old man who allegedly cheated a woman of about ₹7.13 lakh after offering to marry her, Rachakonda Police tweeted on Sunday. In 2021, the accused asked for money by claiming various issues and later when the woman asked about marriage, he stopped responding to her calls. The accused and the woman had met in 2016.

358.title: Ex-SC judge says 'If I say I don’t like PM's face, somebody might arrest me'; Rijiju replies
358.article_body: A former Supreme Court judge, Justice B N Srikrishna, has said that if he were to say publicly that he doesn't like the PM's face, somebody might raid him or arrest him. Union Minister Kiren Rijiju responded, "Those people who speak all the time without any restrictions to abuse the popularly elected Prime Minister are crying about freedom of expression!"

359.title: Bhartaul becomes 1st village in UP to have RO water in every home
359.article_body: As part of the Adarsh Gram Panchayat initiative, Bhartaul in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly district reportedly became the first village in the state to have RO water in every household. Four RO plants have been set up in the village to make clean water accessible to everyone. "It will save people from water-borne diseases," said Jag Pravesh, Chief Development Officer, Bareilly.

360.title: Rahmanullah Gurbaz smashes highest score in T20 Asia Cup history, breaks Rohit's record
360.article_body: Afghanistan's 20-year-old opener Rahmanullah Gurbaz on Saturday night recorded the highest score in men's T20 Asia Cup history. Rahmanullah scored 84(45), including four fours and six sixes, against Sri Lanka in the first Super 4 stage match of Asia Cup 2022. The previous record was held by Rohit Sharma, who slammed 83 runs off 55 deliveries against Bangladesh in 2016.

361.title: BJP can be reduced to 50 seats in 2024 if Opposition unites: Nitish
361.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Saturday said that the BJP could be confined to less than 50 seats in the 2024 Lok Sabha elections if the Opposition parties set aside their differences and unite. He said he would visit Delhi to work for a larger Opposition alliance. This comes after five JD(U) MLAs in Manipur joined BJP.

362.title: Pune woman gets nose surgery as husband beats her for not decorating Ganpati
362.article_body: A 31-year-old woman in Pune had to undergo plastic surgery for her nose after her husband allegedly threatened her and beat her up with an iron rod for not decorating lord Ganesha idol amid the ongoing Ganesh Chaturthi festival. The woman's mother-in-law was also involved in the incident. "We have registered...FIR against the man and his mother," police said.

363.title: Pune records 2nd hottest September day since 1996 with 34.4°C temperature
363.article_body: Pune, on Saturday, recorded its second hottest day in September since 1996. Reports said that 34.4 degrees Celsius day temperature was recorded in Pune on Saturday. “The temperature rise is due to sunlight at forenoon...day temperature over 33 degrees Celsius along with high moisture have resulted in general cloudy conditions during the afternoon and evening time,” an official said.

364.title: Railways to undertake 5-hr jumbo block between 2 Mumbai stations today
364.article_body: The Western Railway has announced that it will be holding a jumbo block of five hours on up and down slow lines between Santacruz and Goregaon stations today (September 4). The jumbo block will be in place from 10 am to 3 pm. The block is announced to carry out maintenance work of tracks, signalling and overhead equipment.

365.title: Fire breaks out in Delhi's Rajouri Garden, 25 fire tenders bring it under control
365.article_body: A fire broke out in a tent godown located near Vishal Enclave of Rajouri Garden in Delhi. Fire Department officials said that the fire brigade was called at 1 am, following which, 25 fire tenders were rushed to the site. News agency ANI reported that it took one and a half hours for the fire to be brought under control.

366.title: Qatar to allow beer sales at FIFA World Cup matches 3 hours before kickoff: Report
366.article_body: Qatar will allow ticketed fans to buy alcoholic beer at FIFA World Cup matches starting three hours before kickoff and for one hour after the final whistle, Reuters reported. However, beer sales won't be allowed during matches, report added. Beer would be available for sale within ticketed perimeter surrounding each stadium, but not in stadium stands or concourse, report stated.

367.title: Telangana CM, TRS taking instructions from AIMIM: State BJP chief
367.article_body: Telangana BJP chief Bandi Sanjay Kumar on Saturday accused the ruling TRS of taking instructions from AIMIM over the celebration of Hyderabad Liberation Day. "After BJP decided to celebrate September 17 as 'Hyderabad Liberation Day', all parties responded," he said. "But when AIMIM demanded to celebrate 'National Integration Day'...the state government came forward to celebrate it," he added.

368.title: Karnataka logs 941 new COVID-19 cases, 1 death
368.article_body: Karnataka on Saturday reported 941 new cases of COVID-19 and one death due to the infection, as per the state health department. The active caseload in the state stood at 5,203, the daily COVID-19 bulletin said. Bengaluru Urban district recorded 526 cases, the maximum among districts. Bidar, Gadag and Yadgir districts did not report any fresh COVID-19 cases or deaths.

369.title: 4 people shot at on Rohtak university campus over ₹6 lakh debt
369.article_body: Four people, including two students, were shot at by three men over a monetary dispute in Rohtak's Maharshi Dayanand University on Saturday, police said. The incident took place shortly after Haryana Governor Bandaru Dattatreya left the campus following an inaugural event. A complainant said that a man, who owed him ₹6.40 lakh, and his aides opened fire on the campus.

370.title: Michael Schumacher in the best of hands: Former Ferrari F1 boss
370.article_body: Former Ferrari F1 boss Jean Todt said seven-time World Champion Michael Schumacher "is in the best of hands" as he recovers from severe brain injuries due to a 2013 skiing accident. "People ask so much about Michael...(he is) surrounded by people who love him...we are in constant contact," said Todt. The F1 legend is recuperating at his home in Switzerland.

371.title: Few athletes have inspired more people: Barack Obama on Serena Williams
371.article_body: Former US President Barack Obama congratulated tennis player Serena Williams on her career after the 40-year-old athlete retired from the sport on Friday. "Congratulations, Serena, for your heart, skill, intelligence, dedication, and grace," Obama tweeted. He added, "Few athletes have inspired more people both in and beyond their sport!" Williams has won 23 Grand Slam singles titles in her career.

372.title: Labourer killed in wall collapse in Delhi's Mustafabad, 2 injured
372.article_body: A labourer was killed after a wall collapsed at a construction site in northeast Delhi's Mustafabad area on Saturday, police said. The deceased was identified as 25-year-old Manoj Kumar. Two others were injured in the incident. The injured have been admitted to the Jag Pravesh Chandra Hospital, the police informed.

373.title: 25 lakh households received zero electricity bills: Punjab Minister
373.article_body: Punjab Power Minister Harbhajan Singh on Saturday said the AAP government in Punjab has fulfilled its promise of providing 300 units of free electricity per month. He added that 25 lakh households have received zero electricity bills. This was the first time a government is fulfilling its election promises in the initial year itself, Singh claimed in a statement.

374.title: Bail application of seer Shivamurthy Murugha postponed to Monday
374.article_body: The application seeking anticipatory bail for Murugha Mutt seer Shivamurthy Murugha Sharanaru has been postponed to Monday by a district court in Karnataka. He had reportedly applied for bail on medical grounds. Earlier, he had been taken to hospital after complaining of chest pain. He has been accused of sexually assaulting two girls in a hostel run by the mutt.

375.title: Too early to rule Ravindra Jadeja out of T20 World Cup 2022: Dravid
375.article_body: Team India head coach Rahul Dravid said it is too early to rule Ravindra Jadeja out of T20 World Cup 2022 after the all-rounder suffered a knee injury. "The World Cup is a fair way away, so we don't want to jump to any conclusions," said Dravid. Earlier, PTI had reported that Jadeja would need a "major knee surgery".

376.title: That was insane: Red Bull F1's Verstappen on taking pole in Dutch GP
376.article_body: F1 world champion Max Verstappen took pole position at the 2022 F1 Dutch GP, beating Ferrari's Charles Leclerc by less than a tenth of a second. "Unbelievable...We had a difficult day...it was very close...that was insane," said Verstappen. Ferrari's Carlos Sainz came third, with Mercedes' Lewis Hamilton in fourth after Red Bull's Sergio Perez spun out in the final corner.

377.title: No bowler in current Pakistan line-up can replace Shaheen Afridi: Rizwan
377.article_body: Pakistan wicketkeeper-batter Muhammad Rizwan said no bowler in the current line-up could replace injured Shaheen Afridi. "The way he [Shaheen] has performed in the last 1-2 years, no bowler can...fill his shoes," said Rizwan, adding that this was the opportunity to find the next Shaheen. Pakistan qualified for the Asia Cup Super Four after beating Hong Kong on Friday.

378.title: ONGC is being deliberately destroyed by PM Modi: Jairam Ramesh
378.article_body: Congress MP Jairam Ramesh criticised PM Narendra Modi for running ONGC without a regular CMD (Chairman and Managing Director) since April 2021. "ONGC was a crown jewel. Then...[PM Modi] forced ONGC to absorb GSPC (Gujarat State Petroleum Corporation), a scam-ridden company," Ramesh tweeted. He added, "[ONGC is] being deliberately destroyed so that one of the 'Humare Do' takes it over."

379.title: Explore joint solutions to water disputes: Amit Shah to south states
379.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah has urged southern states to look for joint solutions to address water-sharing disputes. Shah was addressing the 30th southern Zonal Council Meet in Thiruvananthapuram on Saturday. Inter-state water disputes in the south include the Krishna river water sharing dispute between Telangana and Andhra Pradesh and the Cauvery dispute between Tamil Nadu and Karnataka.

380.title: Vijay Deverakonda to return ₹6 crore to 'Liger' producers after film flops: Reports
380.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda has planned to give back a large portion of his remuneration for 'Liger' to the producers to compensate for the film's box-office performance, as per reports. He will reportedly return more than ₹6 crore to the producers to reduce the burden of losses. 'Liger' was reportedly made on a budget of ₹100 crore.

381.title: There is an 'undeclared emergency' in the country: JD(U)
381.article_body: The Janata Dal (United) on Saturday passed a resolution alleging that there is an "undeclared emergency" in the country. It also alleged that the BJP government is trying to silence the Opposition voices by misusing probe agencies. The party also claimed that minorities are being targeted in the country. The national executive meeting of JD(U) was held on Saturday.

382.title: 32-year-old man gets 20 years in prison for minor's rape in Odisha
382.article_body: A court in Odisha's Ganjam district on Saturday handed a 20-year prison sentence to a 32-year-old man for abducting and raping a 14-year-old girl in 2018. The court also imposed a fine of ₹55,000 on the convict. The rape survivor was awarded a compensation of ₹6 lakh. The convict had sexually assaulted the teenager after kidnapping her from her home.

383.title: Karan Johar and Rajamouli have united the Indian film industry: Jr NTR
383.article_body: Actor Jr NTR, during the promotional event for 'Brahmastra' in Hyderabad, said that Karan Johar and SS Rajamouli have united the Indian film industry. "Let us hope...Karan sir achieves yet another milestone with this movie," he added. Karan Johar is producing the upcoming film. Jr NTR further said he hopes "Brahmastra emerges as the Brahmastra of our Indian film industry".

384.title: World noted India's independent stance on Ukraine war: EAM Jaishankar
384.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Saturday said India's stand on the Russia-Ukraine war was "noted" by the world. Speaking at the Indian Institute of Management, Ahmedabad, Jaishankar said when two countries are at war there is pressure on third parties to carefully choose sides. "The fact that we have taken an independent stance...that the world has noted," he said.

385.title: India's first female racing champion Alisha Abdullah joins BJP
385.article_body: Indian bike and car racing champion Alisha Abdullah joined the BJP in Chennai on Saturday. BJP's Tamil Nadu President K Annamalai was present in the event. "I am very happy to welcome a true sporting icon and fabulous competitive racer today," Annamalai said. Alisha is the country's first female national racing champion.

386.title: Tribal girl found hanging from tree in J'khand, mother alleges rape
386.article_body: A 14-year-old girl belonging to the tribal community was found hanging from a tree in Jharkhand's Dumka district, police said on Saturday. The victim's mother has alleged that she was raped, killed and hanged from the tree on Friday. The minor was allegedly sexually exploited by a man on the pretext of marriage.

387.title: Armed groups clash in Libyan capital
387.article_body: Armed factions in Libya fought on the outskirts of Tripoli on early Saturday as groups close to Abdulhamid al-Dbeibah's government consolidated their position. The violence took place in Warshafala which has seen regular clashes in the last 11 years since a NATO-supported movement ousted veteran leader Muammar Gaddafi. Presently, Dbeibah's rival Fathi Bashagha has support in the country's east.

388.title: What is non-Hodgkin's lymphoma that has affected actress Jane Fonda?
388.article_body: Actress Jane Fonda has shared that she has been diagnosed with non-Hodgkin lymphoma. Non-Hodgkin lymphoma is a type of cancer that forms in the lymph system. It begins when a type of white blood cell, called a T cell or B cell, becomes abnormal. The signs and symptoms include swollen lymph nodes, fever, drenching night sweats, weight loss and fatigue.

389.title: I almost died in that event: Serena on French Open 2015 win being her proudest achievement
389.article_body: On being asked about the proudest achievement of her career, Serena Williams said, "[Winning] French Open 2015." She added, "That's definitely the one that I'm taking with me because I almost died in that event. Somehow I won. So that was pretty awesome." Serena was suffering from flu during the tournament and played with a 101-degree fever in the semi-final.

390.title: Zimbabwe's Sikandar Raza criticises commentators for calling Maxwell's dismissal 'lucky'
390.article_body: After Zimbabwe defeated Australia by three wickets on Saturday to record their first-ever ODI victory against Australia in Australia, Zimbabwe batter Sikandar Raza criticised commentators for calling Glenn Maxwell's dismissal "lucky". "It was a lucky one, he knows how lucky it was," a commentator said. Sharing the video, Sikandar wrote, "How's this a lucky one...Please someone help me out here."

391.title: Thousands attend Gorbachev's farewell in Moscow; Putin absent
391.article_body: Thousands of mourners attended late former Soviet leader Mikhail Gorbachev's farewell ceremony in Moscow on Saturday. Later, Gorbachev, who died at the age of 91 earlier in the week, was buried next to his wife Raisa at Novodevichy Cemetery. Putin was absent from the farewell and was said to be travelling to Russia's westernmost exclave, Kaliningrad on the day.

392.title: Sharmila never received criticism for Mansoor's underperformance: Mumtaz
392.article_body: Veteran actress Mumtaz reacted to the hatred that the wives and girlfriends of cricketers receive when they fail to perform on the field. She said her contemporaries Sharmila Tagore and Reena Roy never received criticism if Mansoor Ali Khan Pataudi and Mohsin Khan underperformed. "Why are Bollywood actresses never praised when their cricketer-husband or boyfriends do well on...field?" said Mumtaz.

393.title: Deoghar DC charged with sedition on MP's complaint over airport row
393.article_body: A Zero FIR has been registered by Delhi Police against Deoghar Deputy Commissioner (DC) Manjunath Bhajantri on various charges including sedition on a complaint by BJP MP Nishikant Dubey. This comes after Dubey and nine others, including BJP MP Manoj Tiwari, were booked by Jharkhand Police for allegedly barging into Deoghar airport's air traffic control (ATC) room earlier this week.

394.title: Mahesh Babu's daughter makes 1st television appearance, actor pens note
394.article_body: Mahesh Babu on Saturday penned a note for his daughter Sitara on Instagram as she made her first television appearance. Mahesh and Sitara appeared together on 'Dance India Dance Telugu'. He wrote, "Sitara's first time on television...and our first appearance together...couldn't be more special! Watching her interact with everyone and dance...with such confidence...was a moment of pride for me!"

395.title: Obesity, psychological problems linked to excessive screen time: Study
395.article_body: Excessive screen time can cause obesity and psychological problems in people, a study stated. "Excessive exposure to blue light from...TVs, laptops and phones may have detrimental effects on a wide range of cells in our body, from skin and fat cells to sensory neurons," a researcher said. "[Avoiding]...excessive blue light exposure may be a good anti-ageing strategy," he added.

396.title: Rizwan going back not out was big no; what's the point of it in T20: Wasim
396.article_body: After Pakistani opener Muhammad Rizwan scored 78*(57) against Hong Kong, former pacer Wasim Akram said that Rizwan "going back not out" to him "was a big no". "If you are tired, try to hit boundaries and maybe get out and try and get fresh legs in the middle...What is the point in this format (T20) going not out," Akram asked.

397.title: EU well-prepared in case Russia ceases gas supply: EU official
397.article_body: The European Union is "well-prepared" to face the eventuality of a total halt in gas supply by Russia, thanks to storage capacity and energy-saving measures, EU's Economic Commissioner said on Saturday. Notably, Russian state-run gas company Gazprom on Friday announced that gas supply via the Nord Stream 1 pipeline to Germany would remain suspended indefinitely due to technical reasons.

398.title: Appalled by unruly conduct of FM Sitharaman with Collector: KTR
398.article_body: After Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman questioned Kamareddy District Collector Jitesh Patil over the absence of PM Narendra Modi's pictures at fair price shops, Telangana minister KT Rama Rao said, "I am appalled by [Sitharaman's] unruly conduct." He also complimented Patil on his "dignified conduct", adding, "These political histrionics...will only demoralise hardworking AIS officers."

399.title: Govt school PTI booked for sexually harassing girl students in Rajasthan
399.article_body: A Physical Training Instructor (PTI) of Kendriya Vidyalaya school in Rajasthan's Jodhpur has been booked for sexual harassment and indecent behaviour with girl students. At least 12 girls aged between 15-17 years have alleged that the accused used to call them on phone and force them to have obscene talks with him. The girls had complained to the school management.

400.title: Iran says it has equipped 51 cities with civil defence systems
400.article_body: Iran's Defence Ministry on Saturday said that 51 cities in the country have been equipped with civil defence systems to prevent any possible foreign attacks. The systems enable authorities to "identify and monitor threats by using round-the-clock software, according to the type of the threat and risk", Deputy Defence Minister General Mahdi Farahi said, as per the local media.

401.title: Shah directs Ahmedabad civic body to solve garbage disposal issues in 3 days
401.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah has directed the Amdavad Municipal Corporation (AMC) to resolve the issue of garbage disposal in the localities of Bopal, Ghuma and Ambli within three days. Shah has asked Municipal Commissioner Lochan Sehra to resolve the issue, which has emerged due to a strike by sanitation workers, BJP's Gujarat unit said.
